Su obra ha sido presentada en diversos museos, centros de arte contemporáneo, galerías y espacios artísticos de países como España, Portugal, Francia, Italia, Dinamarca, Reino Unido, Alemania, Grecia, México, Colombia, Venezuela, Perú, Ecuador, Argentina, Estados Unidos, China, Filipinas y Japón.
El artista español Abel Azcona realizando un performance art en Bogotá (Colombia).

“En esta sociedad pasteuriza, prefiero provocar repugnancia, odio, rechazo, desconcierto, hartazgo, angustia, hostilidad, miedo... que seguir fomentando la asepsia mental.” Con estas palabras se peresenta Rocio Boliver, siguiente artista de nuestro cartel. Ícono de la cultura underground en la ciudad de México, nacida en la misma ciudad en el año de 1956, Rocío Boliver es una artista de performance que concentra su propuesta artística en la crítica a las cargas ideológicas represivas que viven las mujeres, principalmente en México. En 1992 inició su carrera de performance a partir de la lectura de sus textos de corte porno-erótico, desde entonces su obra se ha presentado en Festivales de Europa, Asia, Norte y Sudamérica. En los últmos siete años ha impartido talleres de performance en espacios culturales de Lisboa, Barcelona, Nueva York y Ciudad de México.
La artista mexicana Rocio Boliver ""La congelada de uva"" realizando un performance.

Desde Madrid contaremos con Yolanda Dommínguez, artísta visual licenciada en Bellas Artes por la  Universidad Complutense de Madrid.  Becada por el Ministerio de Cultura de España para la Promoción del Arte Español en el exterior (2010) ha presentado su trabajo en diferentes instituciones y festivales como Photoespaña 2012, JustMad Arte Contemporáneo, Contemporary Culture Festival NOVA in Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro y Barcelona, etc...Su labor artística trasciende al ámbito social y educacional, colaborando con distintas instituciones y organismos oficiales en programas de igualdad y género a través de talleres y conferencias y actualmente es profesora y tutora del Master Concepto y Creación de la Escuela de Fotografía EFTI de Madrid.

Trabaja desde la incomodidad manejando situaciones sensibles e inquietantes para el espectador con el objetivo de generar una crítica social y una reacción. Utilizando herramientas como la ironia o la descontextualización crea situaciones o escenarios en los que el espectador se ve involucrado y puede participar. Estas experiencias se insertan en contextos de la vida real con el objetivo de impactar emovional y mentalmente al espectador involucrando a este en la propuesta.
Performance Art "" Pido para un Chanel"" de Yolanda Dominguez en el centro de Madrid.

La siguente artista en nuestro cartel es Francesca Fini, trabaja la performance canalizandola a través de diferentes medios de comunicación como por ejemplo el video. Sus proyectos, siempre dirigidos a publicaciones sociales y politicas, son mezclados con la tecnología usando así por ejemplo audio en vivo. Muy interesada en la videoperformance tiende a crear desde su obra materia gráfico, lo que ella llama “relquias”.  Sus videos y trabajos tangibles los considera capñitulos de una historía interminable de la cua ella misma es la protagonista. Fini, con una educación profunda como artista digital  trabajó durante 15 años en el campo de la televisión, en el años 2000 después de conocer al artista americano Kristin Jones crearon juntos el proyecto “Tevereterno”, en el cual crearon instalaciones para la ciudad de Roma. Con él y otros artistas asistió en 2008 al Festival del Río en Nueva York proyectando su animación “el lazo de la luna”. Ha participado tamibién en la Bienal de Polonia en 2011, y ha sido finalista en los premios Laguna Internacional de Arte de Venecia así cmo en el Festival de cine de Montpellier.
La artista Francesca Fini realizando la performance "" Blind"" en la ciudad de Roma.
Continuamos con Regina José Galindo, nacida en Guatemala destaca por ser una poetisa que experimenta con nuevos escenarios fusionando la literatura con la performance.

Su trabajo se caracteriza por el contenido político que rescata elementos propios de su contexto cultural y de su condición femenina. Ganadora en 2005 del León de Oro en la bienal de Venecia por su video “Himenoplastia”, en el cual la artista es sometida a una intervención ilegal de reconstrucción de himen. Fue una propuesta sumamente fuerte y gracias a ella también se le otorgó años más tarde el Príncipe Claus. En su obra resalta la denuncia contra el sistema político, tan presente en la historia del arte latinoamericano, y un claro mensaje feminista.

Nadia Granados, artista colombiana interdisciplinar. Se dedica principalmente a la performance utilizando habitualmente la instalación. Su obra se caracteriza por la resignificacion de contenidos extraidos de los medios de comunicación mezclados con temas relacionados con la lucha antiglobalización.

Francesca Leoni, artista italiana, creció en Brasil. Graduada en Ciencias de la Comunicación en la Universidad de Carolina del Norte en Wilmington. Durante su época universitaria se involucro en el mundo del teatro. Al volver a Italia comenzó a trabajar en la producción de videos y siguió formandose en teatro y performance.
El artista belga Robin Pourbaix en un instante de una de sus performances.",7.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Welcome to my new project ""Art Needs Direction"". I have been stewing on this idea for quite some time now.  To break it down quick, it is an idea to sell my artwork and also raise money for a good cause.  Thanks in advance for your generosity.
The way this works is on the side >
column2: of the page. There are rewards for your gracious donations.  Every dollar goes toward the main goal.  Ideally, if I reach my goal of $1,500, this would cover art supplies and my time + I want to donate $500 towards the foundation for Maddox, the boy that was killed at the Pittsburgh Zoo.

column1: This is somewhat of a crossover of me getting my art out there and also helping in the process.  Generally in life, I always look to help someone in need
column2: but asking for help is ironically where I need help.  I don't want to write a book here, but I honestly could.  So, instead of asking for handouts or forever trying to sell my art, I figured why not give back in every step of the process.  I literally try to make new art everyday.  I am not only honored when someone is interested in my art, but furthermore it is something that will always be a part of me.

column1: The idea of mixing business with something so personal and near to my heart has always been difficult .  I always wished that I could just make art and then not have to worry about selling it.  I have always just created paintings, and when someone wanted something I would make it for them.  But as I get older, I keep making more and more.  It obviously gets expensive to just buy supplies and not necessarily have anything supporting it.

I am a firm believer that if you have a talent it is up to you to not only explore it, but share it with others.  If you sing..... well SING!.  If you are someone that is a fine teacher then I hope that you can find some way to share that.  It is this premise that all of my ideas for this project came about.  I paint and love sharing it with others.  I also like helping others but at times it becomes extremely difficult to help others when I should be helping myself.
That being said, there are also rewards along the way that correspond with the project. They are listed on the side.  That is mainly the bidding overview.

Buttttttt here is where it gets interesting.  Yes, you could get a 36""x30"" painting retailing as the goal amount($1,500) for $10.  If not, then all perks will be honored and sent out accordingly and all goes to the goal.  One disclaimer:  I thought it would be exciting to also include (1) limited BUY NOW bid!  That would obviously be greatly appreciated and exciting, so that donor would receive the piece.  For this scenario I am going to have 2 paintings comparable in size and price.  Ok, if I still have not lost you then let me recap...
2 paintings + one family + many gracious donations = one goal

I will show 2 paintings.  You can donate any amount (every dollar counts). With your generous donation, I will also ask to include which piece you are interested in.  The project will run its course and the lucky winner will get the desired art.  I want to raise $1000 for artwork supplies and $500 towards the boy's family that endured such a great loss.
Charity Info:
The family and friends of a two-year-old boy, who was fatally mauled by wild African dogs at the Pittsburgh Zoo, have set up a Christmas charity to honor his memory.

The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports Thursday that organizers of the Trucks for Maddox charity hope to make it an annual event.  The parents of Maddox Derkosh originally requested the trucks instead of flowers because the boy loved to play with trucks and share them with his friends. More than 4,000 trucks have already been donated. They'll be given to Christmas charities for needy children.

Summary

My name is Andrew Kosorok.  I am a Christian stained glass artist and teacher, seeking to build bridges of peaceful understanding among neighbors of different faiths.  In the US we are blessed with freedom of faith, but sometimes poor information and fear overcome our natural inclination to be civil to each other.  Drawing on my experience as an artist, educator, and interfaith minister, I am exploring Islam through art--and sharing what I find.

The glass sculpures are explorations of the 99 Most Beautiful Names of God of Islamic tradition, Names which serve to guide the faithful in becoming better people--similar to the Christian Beatitudes.  As the sculptures are completed, they are exhibited in traditional galleries and other settings and provide a beautiful backdrop for communication among very different people.  As visitors view the displays, everchanging and unique as new sculptures are finished, fascination turns to respectful curiousity, then blossoms into a desire to understand and appreciate each other.

At the displays, Christians raised to hate Muslims open their hearts to their neighbors, and Muslims feeling constantly defensive realize their neighbors are fellow beings of faith.  Neighbors have a right not to be afraid of each other, and these sculptures are providing a concrete catalyst for this change to happen.  As the sculptures are completed and shown, the impact expands:  more people want to listen to their neighbors of other faiths, more people are grateful to find their neighbors care about them, and more people find the exhibits give them the courage to undertake their own constructive, peacebuilding projects.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

The two overarching and parallel goals for the 99 Names Project are to build glass sculptures for each of the 99 Most Beautiful Names of God from the Qur'an, and to display them in 99 different cities--across the country and into the world--as the sculptures are being completed.  The individual sculptures have been valued at $9000 to $12000 each, but they are not being built for profit.  Each Name sculpture requires only $500 in materials, but takes about 100-150 hours to complete, and the effects they have on the people who see them are profound.  The project is divided into 4 sections of 25 sculptures to make it more manageable--as each work is finished and each exhibit is shown, the positive influence of the project expands.

The glass used is German New Antique imported from Europe, the paint used is a unique blend of enamel and mason stains I developed specifically for the project, the designs and structures are all original and derived from my expanding experience with Islamic art and history.  Because of the inflexible nature of glass, each sculpture is built out of paper and cardboard before final construction, and drilling holes in the carefully fit and hand-beveled pieces becomes an exercise in patience.

Sculptures for the 25 Names in the first section are completed, and thank-you gifts come from these unique images.  Each donor will be placed on an email list to receive updates for the project (if desired), receives a blank note card with an image of a completed sculpture (which they in turn can use for a thank-you note of their own), a piece of glass from the glass sculpting process, and helpful suggestions on using bridge-building techniques to strengthen a diverse community.  Also, wallpaper and slideshows from the series, a blank journal with cover images drawn from the completed sculptures, and fused-glass jewelry using designs from the project are among the thank-you gifts.  A photo book of the first 25 sculptures with insights to what the Names mean, a selection of unique note cards drawn from the series, and an in-depth book on the process behind each sculpture are also included among the thank-yous.  And, to thank the spectacularly charitable at the $5000 mark, all the preceding thank-yous will be given including a full set of note cards plus one of the new Beautiful Names sculptures built as a result of their donation, sent along with a short film documenting its first showing.

If the goal for the period is not met, all the money raised will go to building the sculptures--one for each $500 raised.  And every donor will also receive invitations to the exhibits and events in which the sculptures they made possible will be shown.
<div>
The Impact
Building sculptures of the 99 Most Beautiful Names is not just about building art
column2: it is a process of open-minded bridge building and peaceful resolution of differences.  The most fundamental connection in communities is between neighbors, and the most potent weapon against fear and misunderstanding is education.  The sculptures provide a tangible record of our ongoing effort to overcome apprehension and strengthen society, to build stable neighborhoods based on mutual respect and appreciation of differences, and to create an environment in which our children learn the practical tools necessary to build the peaceful world neighborhood in which we wish them to grow old.  By experiencing the sculptures, by visiting the exhibits, and by learning about the impact they are having, others who wish to build bridges of peace will know they have the capacity to do so, and will take their own active role in building a happier, more peaceful world.

column1: <div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please tell people you know about the project and visit my website for more information
column2: I am always happy to answer questions about bridge-building among neighbors and learning how to overcome misunderstanding and apprehension regarding those who are different.  Feel free to visit my twitter feed, as well, and become a friend.  And don't forget to share this project using the Indiegogo share tools--sometimes the greatest impact we can have is through the lives of those we think we merely brush against.  And look for ways you can learn about those who are different, and help them feel they belong--this world is big enough for all of us.

I am feeling the wind beneath my wings. As you have seen in the video, I am a photographer with a unique sense of artistic expression.I have spent many days taking photgraphs in my neighborhood. Now it is time to go back to my roots. My obsession with my work and the images I create is taking me back to “old country” - Europe, to capture unseen textures of old facades. This facinating new project will not happen without your help.
What Do I Need Your Support For:
My next exhibit is Glenview Mansion Art Gallery and with your help new images will hang on the wall.
<ul>
• I need to get there. My travel cost to reach multiple designations in Europe
• Printing and framing costs for the exhibit
• Photography book with the images captured
• Outreach to get maximum exposure
Other Ways You Can Help:
Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t mean you can’t help:
<ul>
• Please spread the word about the campaign with your friends on Facebook, LinkedIn Twitter or email.
• Think of someone who needs a unique piece of art as a present. With a limited prints on all my work, this present will not only entrancing art work but rare collectable in the future.
• Write to me and let me know what you think. Your feedback is as important as much as your financial support.

I appreciate all levels of your support.

The Odd Couple a Thesis Production!

We are to Graduate students getting our MFA in the preforming arts department at the Savannah College of Art and Design.  For our thesis we have decided to put on Neil Simon's The Odd couple.  We have a wonderfully talented cast aboard with us and a great crew and are just so excited to put this show on.  


Why we need Funds:

Putting on a theatrical production is extremely expensive so we need help in getting things like materials to build a set, acquiring props, costumes,etc etc.  We also need funds to rent out a rehearsal space for us to practice in leading up to the show.  We need money for printing posters and playbills. And all the small little expensive that pop up in a show this size as the production goes on so we have decided to reach out to you for help noble denizen of the internet!


Our Team:

we have a team of truly stunningly talented actors and crew for this project who are dedicated to putting on a quality production that is sure to delight those who have known The Odd Couple and those who are being introduced to it a new.  We are confident we can bring this show to life and look forward to the chance to do so.


Where and When:

The play itself will be shown on January 30 and the 31 in the Mondanaro Theater in the Savannah College of Art and Design's Crites preforming arts building in Savannah Georgia.


Perks:

We have included a number of recognition levels for our more generous donators but every little bit helps! So please consider Donating and bringing this show to a reality!

The Ghetto Tarot is waiting to be shipped to you:

You can continue to order the Ghetto Tarot deck and perks through this campaign site. We send out the orders once every 10 days.

In case your order gets lost on the way because of the postal service, we cannot give you a refund but we will send you a new one with the next shipment if you let us know within 2 months after the order date. If you make a mistake putting in your shipping address, let us know before the shipping happens, otherwise we cannot refund you or send you a new order.

Thanks a lot for your understanding!

 

Thanks for sharing the enthusiasm for our project! We love you!!
column4:
/>

 

While the cards were designed many years ago with the situations of the time when the world was very different, they resonate today with timeless symbols that can be applied to our busy modern world. And not just our modern, western world, but also to any other continent, country or culture, including the Haitian Ghetto. So here comes a temporary, provocative and vivid tarot deck!

On several cards we used the artists art, that includes symbolism from the Voodoo religion to embody the important meaning of the cards original symbols.

 

The photographer

 

 

My name is Alice Smeets, I am a Belgian photographer, filmmaker, artist and teacher. My documentary photographs from Haiti are fairly well known and have won me several awards including the Unicef Photo of the Year Award 2008.

 

For a long time, I have wanted to interpret the Tarot Deck with my photos, but taking ordinary pictures of the scenes seemed too simple. My aim was to create a very personal deck without loosing the different spirits of the cards. Then the idea entered my mind to combine three of my passions: the spiritual world, the Haitian culture and people as well as the philosophical reflections about the dualities in our world
column5:
in this case rich and poor.

 

 

Since 2007 I have been a regular visitor to Haiti and have lived in the country as well for 2 years. Its complexity and spirituality have played a big role in my life. The observations of the Haitian society have brought answers to many questions I have had.

 

So taking the tarot pictures in the ghetto of Haiti’s capital Port-au-Prince was the obvious choice to create a very personal deck: moving away from the clichéd images of poverty, illustrating the spirits and meanings of the cards with a touch of humor in the middle of the slum and showing colored people for the first time on the traditional, old European cards to break stereotypes.

 

 

 

Collaborating artists: The Haitian Ghetto Tarot actors

 

 

All the artists of the group ATIS REZISTANS grew up in downtown Port-au-Prince, in an atmosphere of junkyard make-do, survivalist recycling and artistic endeavour. Their powerful sculptural collages of engine manifolds, TV sets, wheel hubcaps and discarded lumber have transformed the detritus of a failing economy into bold, radical and warped sculptures.

 

Having known the group of artists “Atiz Rezistans” for a very long time, they immediately jumped on board to create the Ghetto Tarot deck together. Being very spiritual themselves and working a lot with voodoo symbolism, they immediately understood the spirits of the cards.

 

Atis Rezistans were very helpful to find the materials needed and often created them on the spot, like the lantern for the Hermit that is created out of a old metal can or the black cat for the Queen of Wands and the animals on the Moon that are made out of used car tires.
column6:
/>

 

 

 

 

Why call it Ghetto Tarot?

 

According to the common definition, the ghetto is a part of a city in which members of a minority group live, especially because of social, legal, or economic pressure. The term was originally used in Venice to describe the part of the city to which Jews were restricted and segregated.

 

Today, a commonly used definition of a ghetto (especially in the United States) is communities distinguished by a homogeneous race or ethnicity. Additionally, a key feature that continues to symbolize the demographics of American ghettos is the prevalence of poverty. Poverty constitutes the separation of ghettos from other, suburbanized or private neighborhoods. The Haitian people have long ago adopted the word Ghetto into their own language Creole and use it to name the poorest neighborhoods of their cities.

 

Our idea behind choosing the term ""Ghetto"" as a name for the deck, is to provoke a discussion around the topic, to have people question their own assumptions about what the ghetto really is and to change the often negative connotation that the word implies in our culture into a positive one. The name of the Ghetto Tarot is inspired by the ""Ghetto Biennale"", which is an invitation by Atis Rezistans to visiting Western and non-Western artists to come to Haiti and create art in collaboration with them to produce a show at the end. Atis Rezistans use trash to create art with their own visions that are a reflection of the beauty they see hidden within the waste.

 

Our intention is not a glorification of the life in the Ghetto, but to feature the Haitian Ghetto and poverty in general in another light. I have observed over and over again that those, who the world calls ""the poor"", are full of strength, full of life, joy and creativity. I believe we need more people in this world to start looking at them that way and stop seeing them as victims of a deserted and hopeless situation. A desirable consequence of this imagined situation is a reintegration of the lost self-trust into their own original ideas.

 

Since generations Haitians have witnessed people telling them that they are poor and that they need western ""solutions"" to their problems and many have associated themselves with this idea a long time ago.

 

Our objective is to highlight the creativity and strength of the citizens of the Ghetto and we are certain that inside of them lays a treasure of innovative ideas to dissolve the circle of dependence and victimization, that will break through if the world starts looking at their skills and capacities instead of their deficiencies. That plays an important part of the objective behind the photographies of the ""Ghetto Tarot"": reaching beyond cultural walls of prejudice and ignorance to achieve a much needed transformation of the collective conscience perception of the Ghetto.

 

Atis rezistans are claiming the word “Ghetto”, free themselves of its depreciating undertone and turn it into something beautiful. Their act of appropriating a word loaded with unfavorable sentiments by altering its meaning is an act of inspiration. This undertaking of the Haitians made me realize that it lies only within us to assign value or judgment towards a tangible or intangible thing, which creates a positive or negative emotion. If we realize that we can choose if we look at destruction and see despair or if we choose to see the start of something new, we can change the meaning of every word, action and emotion. That is something I learned from the Haitian artists and we are sharing it together with the world through the Ghetto Tarot.

 

And isn’t the confrontation of our inner feelings and emotions what tarot is all about?

 

 

 

 

 

The Project

 

In the last campaign we received enough funding to print the first edition of the Ghetto Tarot. Our new goal is the creation of a wonderful website with not only all the information, photos and behind the scene infos of the Ghetto Tarot, but also short videos where the artists will show you and explain their way of life in their home, the Haitian Ghetto.

 

The artists will receive 20% of the profit of the Ghetto Tarot. This amount was agreed upon, taking into account the amount of work each party has put into the project.

 

 

NOTE: Recently I came across rumors saying that this project is exploitative of the Haitians. The artists are being paid as partners according to the work everyone has put into the project. This is not a charity project, neither is it an act of exploitation. I would pay my European coworkers the same amount, I am paying the Haitians. I do not believe pity is helping anyone, I believe in partnership. If you are interested in finding out why, check out the documentary I directed two years ago: www.aidependence.com

 

 

 

 

So, What’s in it for you? That’s a good question. A lot actually.

 

REWARDS!

 

1. The Ghetto Tarot Deck:

 

This is probably why you’re here. If you pre-order the deck through Indiegogo, you’re not only getting one of the First Edition, but you’ll get 10 Euro off the original price! Yeah, it’s just that great. Not into tarot at all but you still managed to read this far? Cool, that’s totally fine - check out the awesome photography print and workshop options in the next section!

 

 

2. The Limited Edition Fine Art Photographic Prints and Posters:

Get your own favorite card as a photographic fine art, signed print in two different sizes. And the first 30 people (for each size) will save a lot!!

You want to have all photos? Get the rare, limited edition photobook signed by the artist that has them all (it only exists 30 times).

It’s too much for you? Get a poster. Its not signed, its not part of a limited edition, but it's still awesome!

 

 

3. Photography workshops

Get your own one-on-one photography workshop or get a group together to invite me to your place to give a photography workshop. I have given plenty of workshops before and my students have seen a rapid improvement in the way they are taking pictures.

 

 

4. More

But that's not all. There are more surprises! Check them out!

 

 

 

","The Ghetto Tarot is waiting to be shipped to you:You can continue to order the Ghetto Tarot deck and perks through this campaign site. We send out the orders once every 10 days.In case your order gets lost on the way because of the postal service, we cannot give you a refund but we will send you a new one with the next shipment if you let us know within 2 months after the order date. If you make a mistake putting in your shipping address, let us know before the shipping happens, otherwise we cannot refund you or send you a new order.Thanks a lot for your understanding! Thanks for sharing the enthusiasm for our project! We love you!!   While the cards were designed many years ago with the situations of the time when the world was very different, they resonate today with timeless symbols that can be applied to our busy modern world. And not just our modern, western world, but also to any other continent, country or culture, including the Haitian Ghetto. So here comes a temporary, provocative and vivid tarot deck!On several cards we used the artists art, that includes symbolism from the Voodoo religion to embody the important meaning of the cards original symbols. The photographer  My name is Alice Smeets, I am a Belgian photographer, filmmaker, artist and teacher. My documentary photographs from Haiti are fairly well known and have won me several awards including the Unicef Photo of the Year Award 2008. For a long time, I have wanted to interpret the Tarot Deck with my photos, but taking ordinary pictures of the scenes seemed too simple. My aim was to create a very personal deck without loosing the different spirits of the cards. Then the idea entered my mind to combine three of my passions: the spiritual world, the Haitian culture and people as well as the philosophical reflections about the dualities in our world

column3: > Audiovisual art and new media in urban space

column1: September, 7-12th 2015
<div>
«Construction»
is a festival of new media and audiovisual art in urban space. The
project appeals to physical and perceived image of Dnipropetrovsk,
discovering a new vision of its peculiarities and raising attention
to our commons: space, responsibility and future.
The
festival combines topics of urban planning, social and cultural
development, and creative needs of people living in post-industrial
and post-soviet cities. During the festival
week, symbolic places and public spaces of Dnipropetrovsk will host a
number of events. Thus, it becomes possible to draw public attention
to the outstanding buildings and forgotten spaces of the city, which
form its historical and modern image, to renovate their role in the
memory and to have a new look at their value.
Installation by Daniil Galkin. Railway station ""Pivdennyy"". Construction Festival 2014. Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine
Surprising
locations will be chosen to enhance the positions of experimental,
interactive art and to promote participation of citizens in creative
process. New media will take a role of spectacular tool that reflects
flow of time at its best. The festival will be followed up by
discussions, presentations and workshops with Ukrainian and foreign
experts in the fields of media art, new technologies in art, and
creative urbanism.
Construction-2015
continues experimenting with city. Now we take a look at «form and
content», discover gray spots in urban fabric and check their
substance. Historical artefacts will be examined for their vitality
and tolerance of contemporary art. Social innovations will be put in
the spotlight of our creative research. And spaces for cooperation
will get the core point in problems of festival’s discussion and
educational program.
The
whole process of interaction with spaces and institutions will be
documented. So we will learn ability of an old to come to dialogue
with a new, to collaborate and to change. Is old form able to accept
new content and pass the survival test?
Audiovisual performance by Ujif Notfound. Planetarium. Construction Festival 2014. Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine
activities and events

festival days (September,
7-12th 2015) a row of events will

A

for installations, concerts and art interventions in urban spaces.
<ul>

Artists
(media-art, 3D-mapping, computer technologies, multimedia,
performance), musicians (experimental electronic music, sound-art),
experts in the fields of creative urbanism from Ukraine, Poland,
Germany, Czech Republic, Lithuania, etc. will be invited as guests
of the festival. It’s aimed to involve local art communities to
actively participate in events and actions.

• Excursions
and field studies to different locations will familiarise the
artists with specific features of urban planning of Dnipropetrovsk
and its cultural codes.
<ul>
<li>
City
facilities will be offered to the artists for specific creative
transformation of urban spaces. Installations in urban spaces (up to
8 locations) will aim to establish and activate civic connections.
<ul>

A
range of panel discussions and presentations on topics of creative
approaches and art events will be organized for broad audience.
<ul>

practical workshops will be organized for artistic community to
share ideas and to develop different methods and technologies in
contemporary art.
<ul>
<li>
Specific
audiences will be involved: IT specialists – to get to know new
technological opportunities in art
to look how creative industries change city development strategies
young people – to activate their participation in creative public
processes.
<ul>
<li>
All
the festival events will be documented, filmed and promoted in mass
media to share positive festival experience, to continue social
dialogue and to drive further initiatives.
Installation by Daniil Galkin. Railway station ""Pivdennyy"". Construction Festival 2014. Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine
Festival
«Construction»
backgrounds
Most
of the cities in Central and Eastern Ukraine have been growing in the
times of industrialisation, around the enterprises, which gave
employment. Ideology of the USSR was promoting development of
material and technical base, but not of human resources, or
development of personality. Civil open spaces were subordinated to
integrated system, and accordingly, many cities had nothing
individual to them.
This results in cities of today, without the
former centralised top-down system existing material and technical
base of cultural sector declines or commercialises. Commercialisation
of public spaces is recognised as one of urgent problems in
Dnipropetrovsk. With absence of social values and content in public
spaces, this vacant niche is taken over by drive of financial gain.
The situation is also complicated by absence of art higher education,
which would if there, create platforms to gather creative groups and
build up cultural context.
Concert of experimental music by ZSUF. Art-centre ""Kvartira"".
Having
learned the cultural situation in detail while working on a project
«Cultural
mapping of Dnipropetrovsk»
(2012-2013), we have defined productive base for useful projects. The
central geoposition of Dnipropetrovsk, multiculturalism, dynamics,
and reasonably strong economic base are considered to be positive
factors. Post-industrial features of the city, with its typical
soviet infrastructure, neglect of former cultural locations and
problematic access to the city’s public spaces effect
destructively. This is introducing a number of challenges to young
artistic communities.
Therefore, we believe the following objectives
to be prospective: strengthening the role of urban public space,
developing its culture formative functions
artistic education
column2: development of dynamic modern technologies in

column1: art, which can become a gathering point for educated and experienced
professionals in different fields
of youth artistic communities and multiplication of their creative
energy.
Electroacustic performance. Aquarium. Construction Festival 2014.Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine

We aim to make most of the festival’s events free and as accessible as possible. The predicted audience reach is around 10 000 people. We are getting IT specialists, architects and local active youth involved in order to explore opportunities for the use of new technologies in art and city space improvement.

The festival team has already done a lot to ensure quality presentation of new technologies.  We are starting this Indiegogo campaign to raise the funds that will be used for the art program. Your participation will allow us to provide artists with resources necessary to bring their ideas to life and create unique art objects that deal with themes that are at the forefront of social discussion.
The funds raised will be spent on materials for artists and creation of the video report about the festival.
Lecture by Andrey Gorohov. Art-centre ""Ya Gallery"". Construction Festival 2014. Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine

Beginnings
My life has been defined by certain markers – The kind that completely
shift one’s consciousness.  When I was
around 3-4 years old, our family moved to Fort Morgan, Colorado.  It was a dusty, dry, grassy place that I
called home for a little over 15 years of my life. Fort Morgan was sanctuary.
I speak of markers and this one event marked
time in a way that I never thought it could.
When I was 19 years old, my mom died.
Last year marked equal time spent with her and without her.  After her death, the sanctuary of Fort Morgan,
and Colorado in general, didn’t exist in the same way.  It became both suffocating and laden with
emptiness. I moved to Seoul, not in an

effort to run away from the loss, but instead to run headlong into it.  After Seoul, came Portland, Oregon.  Time and space away from Fort Morgan has now equaled the time spent within its purple, gold, and grassy borders.  20 years since my mom’s death, it’s time
to return to my hometown – To pay my respects to her and to a place - To see
what has changed in me and what remains in my bones.
I speak of markers.
There are undeniable moments when you meet someone and there is an
unnerving comfortability, a connection.
Those moments make an impression because they are so incredibly rare.  Nearly one year ago, I met Lauren Hackett.  An unexpected and exhilarating collaboration
has been born of our friendship.  Not
simply a singular moment of collaboration, this is the beginning of a larger
body of work.  Our initial piece will be
a short experimental film, tentatively titled, Morgan County.  The intent is
not for it to be a travelogue, a saccharine sentimental journey home, or a
scripted film.  It will be a document of
a singular moment in time, in a singular place.
Support
We need your help in making this 7 day trip to Colorado a reality.
Your generous contributions will go directly toward our travel expenses (airfare,
hotel, car rental, and fuel costs, as well as a modest amount for meals). The following is a breakdown of our costs:
column2:
>Flight: $450.00

Car Rental: $583.00

Lodging-5 nights: $930.00

Meals: $200.00

Campaign costs and fees: $665.00

Total costs: $2,828
column4: >As a huge thank you for your support, we are offering a range of perks, in

column1: which we share moments of our journey with you. Perks include:
column2:
>

     -Limited edition postcards with photography from our trip

     -One-of-a-kind Polaroids taken on our trip

     -Digital download of the completed film

     -Behind the scenes video footage from the Colorado plains

     - A special dinner in Colorado or Portland to celebrate you making our work a

column1: Your contribution is not only allowing us to produce our first collaborative piece, but it
is also a catalyst for us to continue this amazing collaboration through future
projects. We cannot take these initial steps without you!
We are so very grateful for any contributions you are able to make.  If
you find that you are unable to financially contribute, please help us spread
the word and share our campaign with your network of folks.
Thank you!
Lauren Hackett is driven by making.  Whether it is through a piece of furniture, a sculpture, an architectural space, or a film
column2: she is guided by the need to make ideas tangible.  Her work is rooted in observations of human experience.  She holds a Professional Bachelor's Degree from the Syracuse University School of Architecture.

column1: Michelle Lee Salnaitis is a student of language, more so a student of silences and that which words cannot reach.  It is her desire and longing to find word or image to articulate the seemingly incommunicable tender blind spots of the human condition.  She holds a Bachelor of Arts in Visual Arts from the University of Northern Colorado and a Master of Fine Arts from Vermont College of Fine Arts.
","Beginnings
My life has been defined by certain markers – The kind that completely
shift one’s consciousness.  When I was
around 3-4 years old, our family moved to Fort Morgan, Colorado.  It was a dusty, dry, grassy place that I
called home for a little over 15 years of my life. Fort Morgan was sanctuary.
I speak of markers and this one event marked
time in a way that I never thought it could.
When I was 19 years old, my mom died.
Last year marked equal time spent with her and without her.  After her death, the sanctuary of Fort Morgan,
and Colorado in general, didn’t exist in the same way.  It became both suffocating and laden with
emptiness. I moved to Seoul, not in an

effort to run away from the loss, but instead to run headlong into it.  After Seoul, came Portland, Oregon.  Time and space away from Fort Morgan has now equaled the time spent within its purple, gold, and grassy borders.  20 years since my mom’s death, it’s time
to return to my hometown – To pay my respects to her and to a place - To see
what has changed in me and what remains in my bones.
I speak of markers.
There are undeniable moments when you meet someone and there is an
unnerving comfortability, a connection.
Those moments make an impression because they are so incredibly rare.  Nearly one year ago, I met Lauren Hackett.  An unexpected and exhilarating collaboration
has been born of our friendship.  Not
simply a singular moment of collaboration, this is the beginning of a larger
body of work.  Our initial piece will be
a short experimental film, tentatively titled, Morgan County.  The intent is
not for it to be a travelogue, a saccharine sentimental journey home, or a
scripted film.  It will be a document of
a singular moment in time, in a singular place.
Support
We need your help in making this 7 day trip to Colorado a reality.
Your generous contributions will go directly toward our travel expenses (airfare,

hotel, car rental, and fuel costs, as well as a modest amount for meals). The following is a breakdown of our costs:Flight: $450.00Car Rental: $583.00Lodging-5 nights: $930.00Meals: $200.00Campaign costs and fees: $665.00Total costs: $2,828As a huge thank you for your support, we are offering a range of perks, in

which we share moments of our journey with you. Perks include:     -Limited edition postcards with photography from our trip     -One-of-a-kind Polaroids taken on our trip     -Digital download of the completed film     -Behind the scenes video footage from the Colorado plains     - A special dinner in Colorado or Portland to celebrate you making our work a       reality
Your contribution is not only allowing us to produce our first collaborative piece, but it
is also a catalyst for us to continue this amazing collaboration through future
projects. We cannot take these initial steps without you!
We are so very grateful for any contributions you are able to make.  If
you find that you are unable to financially contribute, please help us spread
the word and share our campaign with your network of folks.
Thank you!

“The
Resurrection of The Exquisite Corpse”  will be a collaborative world-wide exhibit challenging imagination and creativity
and allowing artists, writers, etc…<span>  to
work together regardless of language barriers, distance, gender, religious
beliefs, cultural differences, etc.. I will also have the public engaged in

participating in some creative collaborations at the opening reception.

There
will be several prominent poets from New York City coming who will read from

their writing collaborations live at the opening reception and engaging with the audience allowing them to also participate.<span> There will be musical collaborations (One musician(s) will compose a set, allowing the
next  to only hear the last few notes to then complete the composition and

they can perform their completed collaboration live at the opening) Ms. Ana Barragan King, dancer and founder of The Latin Ballet of Virginia will also perform...The dancers, where one group will choreograph the first half of their set, leaving
only the last steps for next group to see in order to choreograph and complete
the process and also perform live at the opening.
At
the opening I will have supplies available for the public to participate. The
public will be invited to read their writing collaborations if they would like.
This project is very stimulating for the imagination and is a wonderful
creative challenge. It allows for many who may think they are not creative to
find that they actually are! It also engages everyone to work together and find
that we may be very similar in thought and creative visions. This is a
wonderful project for children as well, as it encourages harmony and in a
natural process, allows for the human race to work together and enjoy and learn
from each other’s styles, cultures and visions.
I believe that this project is also an
excellent tool in helping to eliminate stereotypical expectations of others
that may have hindered the possibility of understanding each other otherwise.

Bily Brown Pottery

My name is Bily Brown and I am opening up a pottery in Kingwood, West Virginia. I earned my education in ceramic arts down in and around Asheville, North Carolina. I spent a couple of years at Haywood Community College pursuing a degree in the ceramic crafts where I learned from a great mentor and friend, Steve Lloyd. I then stayed in the area to work and fire with my friend, Josh Copus.

I moved back to West Virginia to be closer to family, friends, and some of my favorite whitewater in the country. I recently obtained 5 acres and 9 tons of heavy duty fire brick with which to start my pottery.

My goal as a craftsman is to create beautiful and functional pieces of pottery that are affordable to most everyone. I am highly influenced by the nature around me and utilize ceramic techniques that are reflective of the natural processes you see around you. Rippling water, rusting iron, and wood grains are some of the most beautiful inspirations for me personally. I like to think these aesthetic elements find their way into my work.
If you want to see some of my work check out my websites at www.bilybrownpottery.com
column6: >or see some work in my gallery at

column1: -Detail of a Jar-

Why I need your help

There are some obstacles that are keeping me from being a full time potter. The main one being time!

Right now, I am very nearly set up for the first phase of my workshop and kiln. I have the kiln's brickwork nearly down. The next step is to cover it in an insulation layer (cob). Then it's time to fire some pots.  I have a simple workshop set up in my garage where I am producing wares. I also have a reliable wood source to fire my work with. All I need now is the time to fit it all together. That's where you can come in!

With your donation I hope to have the money to finish up the projects needed to start firing my kiln. Your donation will also help me focus more of my time on pottery instead of the restaurant industry.

I am starting off small in the hopes of figuring out the needs of my business without overextending myself.  Some of the things I need to figure out as I grow are where to source clay, wood, and profitable avenues for selling pottery.
Chore List:
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Complete the finishing touches on my kiln (which include cobbing the exterior and building a kiln shed).

column1: • Get a wood stove for my workshop. It gets pretty cold around here.
• Complete my first firing (filling the kiln with work and doing a 12- 16 hour firing).
• Adjust minor design issues that arise with the first few firings.
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Applying to events where I can sell my work. (Craft fairs/shows, galleries, and farmer's markets)

column1: • Make more pots!
-Test kiln in progress-
Some Additional needs:

If this campaign goes better than expected I have a list of other projects that need funding. I need a new vehicle to transport wood to my property as well as take pots to craft shows. I have plans to build a workshop and kiln shed on my property that will make life as a whole more comfortable.  Eventually (within 2 years) I want to rebuild my kiln to a larger and more efficient anagama inspired design. For now, though, this little test tube kiln and garage workshop is perfect for my needs.
<div>
-Vase Form-
<div>
-Sippin Cups-
-My old studio in Asheville-
Risks &

Fortunately for you, the risks are moderately low.  I have already done most of the ground breaking work by creating a space to work. I have also finished 80% of the kiln. So your chosen perk should be sent your way in about 5 months. If there are any changes to this schedule I will let you know through updates and emails.

column5: >I would like to mention that no two kilns are alike. All of my ceramic gifts have an estimated delivery date of March 2016. This is to give me time to fire my kiln a few times and work out the kinks. I want to provide the best piece of work that I can. Thank you for your support.

","Bily Brown Pottery My name is Bily Brown and I am opening up a pottery in Kingwood, West Virginia. I earned my education in ceramic arts down in and around Asheville, North Carolina. I spent a couple of years at Haywood Community College pursuing a degree in the ceramic crafts where I learned from a great mentor and friend, Steve Lloyd. I then stayed in the area to work and fire with my friend, Josh Copus.

I moved back to West Virginia to be closer to family, friends, and some of my favorite whitewater in the country. I recently obtained 5 acres and 9 tons of heavy duty fire brick with which to start my pottery.

My goal as a craftsman is to create beautiful and functional pieces of pottery that are affordable to most everyone. I am highly influenced by the nature around me and utilize ceramic techniques that are reflective of the natural processes you see around you. Rippling water, rusting iron, and wood grains are some of the most beautiful inspirations for me personally. I like to think these aesthetic elements find their way into my work.
If you want to see some of my work check out my websites at www.bilybrownpottery.com or see some work in my gallery at Mudfire Gallery
-Detail of a Jar-
Why I need your help There are some obstacles that are keeping me from being a full time potter. The main one being time!

Right now, I am very nearly set up for the first phase of my workshop and kiln. I have the kiln's brickwork nearly down. The next step is to cover it in an insulation layer (cob). Then it's time to fire some pots.  I have a simple workshop set up in my garage where I am producing wares. I also have a reliable wood source to fire my work with. All I need now is the time to fit it all together. That's where you can come in!

With your donation I hope to have the money to finish up the projects needed to start firing my kiln. Your donation will also help me focus more of my time on pottery instead of the restaurant industry.

I am starting off small in the hopes of figuring out the needs of my business without overextending myself.  Some of the things I need to figure out as I grow are where to source clay, wood, and profitable avenues for selling pottery.
Chore List:
Complete the finishing touches on my kiln (which include cobbing the exterior and building a kiln shed).
Get a wood stove for my workshop. It gets pretty cold around here.
Complete my first firing (filling the kiln with work and doing a 12- 16 hour firing).
Adjust minor design issues that arise with the first few firings.
Applying to events where I can sell my work. (Craft fairs/shows, galleries, and farmer's markets)
Make more pots!
-Test kiln in progress-
Some Additional needs:

If this campaign goes better than expected I have a list of other projects that need funding. I need a new vehicle to transport wood to my property as well as take pots to craft shows. I have plans to build a workshop and kiln shed on my property that will make life as a whole more comfortable.  Eventually (within 2 years) I want to rebuild my kiln to a larger and more efficient anagama inspired design. For now, though, this little test tube kiln and garage workshop is perfect for my needs.

Fortunately for you, the risks are moderately low.  I have already done most of the ground breaking work by creating a space to work. I have also finished 80% of the kiln. So your chosen perk should be sent your way in about 5 months. If there are any changes to this schedule I will let you know through updates and emails.

I would like to mention that no two kilns are alike. All of my ceramic gifts have an estimated delivery date of March 2016. This is to give me time to fire my kiln a few times and work out the kinks. I want to provide the best piece of work that I can. Thank you for your support.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Our Story

WAAR is a new artist initiative in Amsterdam by Sara Bjarland (FI) and Gerbrand Burger (NL). Our main aim is to organize solo exhibitions by international emerging artists, with a focus on work about place, location, mobility and identity. WAAR will work on a migratory basis, using alternative spaces like industrial halls or empty shops for its exhibitions. This way we want to create original shows in surprising locations, using a small budget and maintaining a high level of independence. We think this new way of collective funding through online fundraisers like IndieGoGo, is a great way of funding art projects like ours, connecting artists with different people in a meaningful and interesting way.
WAAR will launch its programme of shows on the 25th of March 2011, with the 16mm film 'Sand' by British artist Naheed Raza.
Before the start of the programme we want to raise the modest funds needed to realize the first three exhibitions.
The Impact

With your support, WAAR will be able to realize a series of interesting, engaging and experimental exhibitions and events. This way we want to explore the modes of exhibition-making in alternative locations, away from the strict 'white cube'. Through these activities we want to connect to both the local (Amsterdam) and the global network of independent artist initiatives.
<h3>What We Need &amp

The $2000/ €1500 we are aiming for, is a starting capital to get us going for the first three exhibitions (about  $650 / €500 per exhibition). Your contribution will enable us to provide for the necessary building materials and equipment to realise our projects, and also to invite one international artist to exhibit in WAAR.

If we don't reach our goal of $2000, we still want to go ahead and do as much as we can with the money we have raised. Any money we raise will be used for covering the costs mentioned above. Any contribution, small or large, will help us to reach our goal!
If you donate between $1 and $24 (€0,7 and €18 euro) we will be VERY thankful!
If you donate $25 (€18) or more, YOU GET: A BIG thank you and a bar of WAAR chocolate
If you donate $50 (€37) or more YOU GET: a limited edition print, made by us
If you donate $150 (€111) or more YOU GET: one of ten unique artworks of your choice, either a drawing by Gerbrand Burger or a photographic print by Sara Bjarland
Other Ways You Can Help
Please forward this page to people you know who might be interested and willing to donate!

column1:
This is  a special reward tier limited to 5 people! Using photos you supply us, we'll draw your favorite pet as a Custom 9""x12"" framed portrait! This is limited to 3 pets.
This is  another special reward tier limited to 6 people! Using photos you supply us, we'll draw your favorite pet(2 at most) and make it into a 13""x13"" pillow! All pillows will be single-sided, 100% cotton, with a sham style back. They'll also be Machine-Washable, so don't worry if your cat gets hair on it!

column5: >The production costs of making Plushies(
column13: >can be very costly and that's where I need your help!

column5: >With your support, Spoonful of Cats will push closer to becoming a worldwide brand! Not to mention get a ton of awesome rewards along the way!

column2: >There are many challenges and obstacles to plush production, but we're confident we can face them and we'll keep you updated to any hurdles we may face along the way! The minimum order of plush we can do is 500 and we'll need close to $1,000 for ocean freight shipping alone. Here's a breakdown of the costs below via a cute cat chart:

>We work directly with our factory in China. What does this mean exactly? This means we do not use a 3rd party company to work with a factory, but speak to our factory directly, which ensures smoother communication and transparency. This will be our 2nd plush created using the same factory. Our first plush was our popular original character: Rainbow Cat!
column5: >The Freight shipping process(whether by ocean or Air) is crucial in understanding and preparing for, which is why I've chosen to work with DHL again to handle the freight shipping. DHL proved to be very helpful, intuitive, and professional when we worked with them to ship Rainbow Cat from overseas.

column2:
>Other Obstacles we may run into may be slight delays in shipping as we prepare paperwork for the shipping process and the possibility of the plush getting held up for a week or so as it clears customs, which is normal.

When can I expect my rewards? I'm aiming to have most of the rewards shipped out in time for Christmas, however this can't be guaranteed and depends on if we can exceed our goal of $5,500. This will also depend on any additional plush that need to be shipped out and require help to process everyone's rewards faster. You will be kept updated every step of the way!

If you are ever unsure or have any questions, don't hesitate to ask :)
I will be here, and I will answer them to the best of my ability.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center

>SPREAD THE WORD! 
(Or in this case..Sushi Cats)

column1: <div style=""text-align: center

column2:
>We need YOUR help to make this project a success! Please help us spread the word by sharing on Social media sites you use like: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Deviantart, and Youtube.

Every little bit helps us go a long way in seeing this projects success and having future plush made of our characters!

You can share the project from Indiegogo by using the ""Share"" icons at the top!
>LETS EAT SOME SUSHI CATS!

column1: ","So who or what is Nekomaki? What does he love to do in his free time? Well...judging by the piece of fish it's hugging I'd say we've got a clue. This cat LOVES Sushi!Nekomaki was once a cat with a dream...A dream to eat every kind of fish in the world...
..One day that dream was put on hold when he got too close to a delicious piece of salmon and rolled up into a little maki roll!
Right now you must be thinking ""That's awful!""
But don't worry! Nekomaki has achieved something no cat has done before. It has become ONE WITH THE SUSHI!
Literally...which is why we call it NekoMaki!

Many of you have gotten to know me over the years since I launched my brand ""Spoonful of Cats"". It's been 5 years since I started on this journey and I'm always looking for fun and exciting ways I can bring the Spoonful of Cat's designs to life for people to enjoy or even their cats!
Some of you have been with me since the beginning, and some of you I've just met. Either way I'm excited to share this next step in my journey with you!
NekoMaki was created with a combo of my love for sushi, cats, and those funny moments cats always get mixed up in. In this case, our little cat Maki wound up in a sushi roll.
It's roughly 11"" tall and 4.5""  wide!
Each Neko Maki plush is made with super soft minky fabric and expertly embroidered details. They also come with a nori/rice wrap and a piece of salmon that can each be removed!
NekoMaki is the perfect size for family trips and hugging!
However, As much as he loves eating salmon all day, he needs to get out to stretch a little!
You can pluck your cat and salmon right out of the nori wrap to let him enjoy some fresh air and stretch!Just keep a watchful eye, or your NekoMaki will run off
column2: free to escape in search of more fish to eat and sushi to get rolled up in.

column1: Maki is also the first sushi cat  plush for our ""NekoZushi"" Collection!
Our cravings for sushi cats is strong so we have a lot more sushi cats prepared for the future! That'll remain a surprise for later on in the campaign~!
So what's in it for you?
We know how much you love cats and sushi so we know you'll love all the awesome and fun rewards we have planned as well as some cool stretch goals!
If we can surpass our initial goal of: $5,500 we can push to try to have these sent out by Christmas and start reaching goals towards more Spoonful of Cats products!
Shipping is not included in the reward amounts. It will be added onto the reward you select. We've kept shipping costs minimal so you won't have to worry about expensive shipping costs!

This is  a special reward tier limited to 5 people! Using photos you supply us, we'll draw your favorite pet as a Custom 9""x12"" framed portrait! This is limited to 3 pets.This is  another special reward tier limited to 6 people! Using photos you supply us, we'll draw your favorite pet(2 at most) and make it into a 13""x13"" pillow! All pillows will be single-sided, 100% cotton, with a sham style back. They'll also be Machine-Washable, so don't worry if your cat gets hair on it!
TO BE ANNOUNCED...
The production costs of making Plushies(stuffed toys) can be very costly and that's where I need your help!
With your support, Spoonful of Cats will push closer to becoming a worldwide brand! Not to mention get a ton of awesome rewards along the way!

There are many challenges and obstacles to plush production, but we're confident we can face them and we'll keep you updated to any hurdles we may face along the way! The minimum order of plush we can do is 500 and we'll need close to $1,000 for ocean freight shipping alone. Here's a breakdown of the costs below via a cute cat chart:

We work directly with our factory in China. What does this mean exactly? This means we do not use a 3rd party company to work with a factory, but speak to our factory directly, which ensures smoother communication and transparency. This will be our 2nd plush created using the same factory. Our first plush was our popular original character: Rainbow Cat! The Freight shipping process(whether by ocean or Air) is crucial in understanding and preparing for, which is why I've chosen to work with DHL again to handle the freight shipping. DHL proved to be very helpful, intuitive, and professional when we worked with them to ship Rainbow Cat from overseas.

Other Obstacles we may run into may be slight delays in shipping as we prepare paperwork for the shipping process and the possibility of the plush getting held up for a week or so as it clears customs, which is normal.When can I expect my rewards? I'm aiming to have most of the rewards shipped out in time for Christmas, however this can't be guaranteed and depends on if we can exceed our goal of $5,500. This will also depend on any additional plush that need to be shipped out and require help to process everyone's rewards faster. You will be kept updated every step of the way!If you are ever unsure or have any questions, don't hesitate to ask :)I will be here, and I will answer them to the best of my ability.
SPREAD THE WORD! (Or in this case..Sushi Cats)

We need YOUR help to make this project a success! Please help us spread the word by sharing on Social media sites you use like: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Deviantart, and Youtube.Every little bit helps us go a long way in seeing this projects success and having future plush made of our characters!You can share the project from Indiegogo by using the ""Share"" icons at the top!

The People's Arts Collective of New Haven, or PAC New Haven, needs your help for its upcoming operating year.

We are newly founded as of August 2012 and exist in response to the apparent lack of an inclusive public workspace for all artists and activists in the Greater New Haven Area. In this case, inclusivity means free domain, no membership required.

The town-and-gown divides that exist between the partitioned, transitory college-aged artists, locally celebrated artists, and locally unrecognized artists just don't work for a conscious arts scene. We aim to address the inherent pseudocommunity symptomatic of a ""college town"" - our work collectively is not just to open up avenues of connection between artists from different milieus, but also affect, on our own terms, responsible interventions into the public discourse. We're located in the heart of downtown New Haven at 212 College Street and we need your assistance!
Our Upcoming, Prioritized Projects (and why we need your help):
1) The FREE SKOOL, our adapted version of SkillShare -

Launching on November 14th, the FREE SKOOL as it stands is a community-taught series of free workshops to bolster basic creative agency in an expensive and alienating commercialized world. Anyone in the Greater New Haven Area, of any gender, sex, nationality, generation, race, capability, is encouraged and thoroughly welcome to sign up to teach or to learn. On the ""syllabus,"" we already have teachers leading workshops in intensive yoga, hitchhiking, graphic design, sewing, parkouring, disposable camera photography, figure drawing, tincture making, woodworking, broadcasting and working groups in protecting oneself against police brutality and raising awareness about violence against women.
Why we need your help:
Each of these workshops has a specific need for supplies, whether disposable cameras or thread and needle. Your contributions will go directly to these public resources.
2) SPACE RENOVATION

New additions to the PAC team include members intent on installing a woodshop and DIY photo lab in our space's basement. These spaces, with a mandatory training, will be open daily to the community to expose photos and craft as they please.
Why we need your help:
Photo supplies. Cheap lumber.
3) ""RAD-ELM"" BOOKSTORE (name in progress)

Approached by a local doula and activist, PAC now intends to delineate a portion of its space a bookstore/info shop engaging with responsible literature and zines for public consumption. This literature will be available for borrowing or for purchase, depending on one's fiscal availability. Themes will range from Black Feminist texts to How-To's on maintaining a vegan lifestyle.
Why we need your help:
To help outfit the space for the bookstore to be mean, clean, and full of sheen. To assist in stocking the shop.
4) SOCIOPOLITICAL INTERVENTIONS

At the end of November, the PAC team will be coordinating two local awareness campaigns in Gender Fluidity and AIDS Awareness. Our gender fluidity intervention seeks to affect popular visual cues that limit our ideas about gender, namely bathroom doors. After a week full of community discussion, a screening of RuPaul's Drag Race, and community design, the last friday of the month will see PAC fixing new inclusive symbols of gender to the doors of the city. Our AIDS awareness campaign will focus primarily on raising awareness about the continued existence of infection in black female populations in the heart of the Greater New Haven area.
Why we need your help:
Materials for placards. Printing costs for flyers, pamphlets, and petitions.
""So, how can I know where the money will go?""

We are maintianing a strict budget transparency system, where the intake and expenditure of all funds will be published live on our website as soon as our indiegogo campaign ends. As of now, we can forecast that we will need, apart from what's mentioned above:
<ol>
• A mere $3000 for our rent for the whole year! (yes that translates to only $250/mth)
• $300 for Internet so our space can be functional as a hub and a research center
CHECK OUT SOME OF OUR RECENT LOCAL PRESS:
THE NEW JOURNAL:
http://www.thenewjournalatyale.com/2012/10/where-the-art-is/
""TOWNIE BLOG"" RUN BY IAN APPLEGATE (OUR OPENING DAY IN AUGUST):
http://townofnewhaven.blogspot.com/2012/08/people-art-center-opens.html
THE YALE DAILY NEWS ( WEEKEND EDITION):
http://www.yaledailynews.com/news/2012/oct/19/friendly-neighborhood-artists-activists/
THE YALE HERALD:
http://yaleherald.com/culture/art-and-activism-in-new-haven/
More information can be found soon on our under-construction site:
http://pacnewhaven.tumblr.com/
Thanks for any and all support! And please, even if you cannot donate, spread widely - a dollar is worth as much as a second, third, or fourth degree holler!

BABYLON SMITH: AN ILLUSTRATED NOVEL
STORY SYNOPSIS

San Angeles, 2260.

Babylon Smith is a freelance Regulator working the mean streets of the mega-city and struggling to make ends meet. Up to his eyeballs in debt from his many addictions, Babylon has to take on any job that comes along just to survive. So, when one of the city’s largest corporations approaches him with a missing person case at triple the going rate, it’s an offer he cannot refuse.

Babylon is tasked with tracking down a high-level asset who has disappeared under mysterious circumstances. At first the case seems simple enough but, as he digs deeper, Babylon soon uncovers a deadly conspiracy that threatens to destroy everything he knows. It’s a journey that will lead him into the heart of the urban sprawl where renegade corporations fight a brutal informational cold war, black market cloning and gene manipulation run rampant, sentient artificial machines govern the teeming, overcrowded streets, and Life + institutions offer virtual life after death.

Joined by his rebellious daughter Medusa and his ex-partner Royo, Babylon must race to unravel the truth and eliminate a ruthless menace before time runs out.
ABOUT US

We are Timothy Bacon and Paul Green and for the last three decades we have worked in broadcast media, interactive media, advertising and branded entertainment as writers and creative directors. We have had numerous screenplays and original television series optioned and have been hired by a number of production companies for rewrite, development and commissioned work.

In the world of branded entertainment, we have worked closely with world-class development teams and helped produce award-winning work on projects ranging from online worlds to digital toys, interactive video experiences, Intellectual and Licensed Properties and mobile applications. Our clients have included everyone from AAA title console games, hit television and film properties, sports teams, car companies, and a host of other major brands.

In 2006, we formed Mutagenic Studios to explore photography and develop our own art styles that would allow us to go beyond the written word, create unique imagery and push the boundaries of our storytelling. Our photographic artwork has appeared in the Montreal Mirror, Guerilla Magazine, Rue Morgue Magazine, and at the Fantasia International Film Festival, the Rue Morgue House of Horror, Club Sin and the 2011 Montreal Fetish Weekend.

The newest version of our website (which has only been up for five months) has attracted over 12,500 views from over 70 different countries. You can see a lot more of our photography, artwork and behind the scenes on the site: http://mutagenicinteractive.blogspot.com
THE PROJECT

Babylon Smith is an illustrated science fiction novel utilizing a unique photo-artwork technique. It is the first book in what we hope will be a line of original graphic and illustrated projects that will bring our many stories to life. We’ve spent our entire careers creating worlds and stories for other people. Now, it’s time for us to produce our own unique visions that go beyond the written word.  This project represents an exciting creative challenge and a new beginning for us.

We have spent the last eighteen months in ‘piecemeal’ development on the book, spending every hour we can between paying jobs to get the project to its current stage. We have learned and developed photo-illustration methods that will work for the graphic format (our process is a combination of ‘live-action’ studio and location photography, 3D models, stock photography and a whole lot of Photoshop). We have written and rewritten the prose and taken around five thousand photographs of over thirty actors and models.
We are now gearing up for the final push on the book to hit our planned September release.
THE PITCH

We need your help! It’s been extremely difficult finding time between jobs to get things completed. There are only so many hours in a day and there’s still a lot left to be done. We need you to help us get across the finish line.

Creating the future is proving to be costly. The money raised here will allow us to complete six remaining photo shoots (average $400 each), put $1000 towards additional props and costuming, purchase about $500 worth of 3D models to add some more science fiction elements to the images and buy about $300 worth of replacement equipment (light bulbs, seamless paper, memory cards for the camera).

We plan on setting aside $1200 for reward fulfillment and the remaining amount will help to offset a few bills as we put aside some of the freelance writing jobs and put more hours into the production over the next four months. It would allow us to hit the late September release we’re aiming for and fulfill a long-standing dream of getting the book done.

Publishing a book in the traditional manner is an expensive proposition. So, in an effort to save money we’re planning on releasing the book through Print on Demand services such as MagCloud (for the magazine format and digital versions) and Blurb (for the hardcover print edition). Print on Demand will not only save on printing, warehousing, shipping and other production costs but also allow our book to be available on virtually every platform from book shelves to computer desktops to mobile devices.
Just pick a reward that suits you and be a part of our creative journey!

If you can’t help with the money, that’s okay! Just make sure to share this page (you can share using the tools right from this page), talk to friends about it and help us to raise support for the project!

There is a small wish list that literally consists of 3 benches from IKEA for the gallery. Because the gallery is not-for-profit in origin, it is bare bones in what is supplied! in short
Hi all!!

Kathy Seff, glass girl here, I'm a second-generation glass artist and grew up working in my moms studio when it was in a two car garage in our home. She would let me exchange my dishes chore with helping her in the studio. I've been working with glass about 24 years and still work side by side with her but now at our main street studio, Colorful Visions Art Glass Studio on Long Island, NY... After 24 years of handmaking glass... It's time to put on a SOLO SHOW!! My FIRST Solo Exhibition runs Sept 24 - Oct 14th, 2012 at Artspace Patchogue Gallery, in Patchogue, NY.
<div>
<h3>what i need &amp

The exhibit is around the corner and I have some final expenses to finish up some projects I have in the making!! One of my favorites and largest to date is creating with art glass to transform a real phonebooth, legit 30+ years old, I purchased into a Stand-Inside Kaleidoscope!! Let's make it happen!All money raised will go to the production of the work and the solo exhibition:
Some of the remaining expenses are:
<div>- hanging hardware &amp
- framing of new works
- kiln firings for 24 plate installation
- glass supplies for phonebooth, skeeball and remaining bike sculptures
- carpentry fees
<div>- paint &amp
- some event expenses (paper goods, beverages, simple nosh)
- exhibition brochure
<div>

When you claim your perk and get tickets to the Low-Light Preview Gala (Sept 23, 7-9pm @ArtspacePatch 20 Terry St. Patchogue) you'll get to see the unveiling and step inside the Kaleidoscope Phonebooth! Hope to see you there!
and there are glass perks too!! Check them out in the Gallery Tab!
<div>
the impact

It's been an amazing journey with all of you by my side giving encouragement and appreciation for what I create in glass. I'd love to fill the gallery with the vision that I've had in my mind's eye. To let you all in to my thoughts and ideas of what glass can be!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this crazy 2nd generation glass artist who is transforming a phonebooth with art glass. Tell your fixie friends this girl from Long Island is soldering glass into the spokes of old bike wheels....
Please contribute &
column2: get one of the perks!! Share this project on facebook, tweet it, pin it, instagram it!! xoxo - kat

          On December 15th,  2016 Irene Ashu Dance Company will be putting on their annual charity event Dance For A Cause.  In light of recent tragic events, this year the company has decided to raise money for the victims of Hurricane Matthew. Each year we pick a specific charity and donate 100% of our proceeds including ticket sales.


This year 100% of the proceeds will be donated to Hope For Haiti, an organization who is using funds to help victims abroad. We are formally reaching out to you/your company to become a donor for our event. The proceeds from the show will go to medication, safe housing, and financial support of the victims of Hurricane Matthew in Haiti. This hurricane will have both short term and long term effects for years to come.


Over 1,027 people have lost their lives
column2:
over 30 people have died of cholera with numbers expecting to rise. Dance For a Cause creates a way for the entire community to get involved and  uplift the lives of others in need both home and abroad. Without financial backing, our dance company is not able to make this fundraising event possible.

All donors/companies will receive a special thank you in our program. Every dollar counts. All donations can be made via Indie Go GO.

Please contact Irene Ashu if you’re a vendor interested in being part of the event.

Thank you for your time, we hope to work together in the rebuilding devastated communities in Haiti.

 

SHOW DATE:

DECEMBER 15th

7:00pm-9:00pm

LOCATION:

ICE HOUSE

429 W Jackson St, Phoenix, AZ 85003

 

Irene Ashu                                                                            Deanna Burrell
irenashu65@gmail.com                                                  Event Coordinator
(480) 636-9356                                                                SimplyHumanEvents@gmail.com
www.IreneAshu.com                                                      (480) 228-1882
