What is KIAF?

Kathmandu International Art Festival (KIAF) is a non-commercial triennale organized by the Siddhartha Arts Foundation. Each edition of the Festival focuses on contemporary arts' response to a particular social issue, with the objective of bringing
column2:
> awareness and engaging the audience at a personal level. 

The 2nd Kathmandu International Art Festival, titled 'Earth|Body|Mind', will commence on the 25th of November and continue for month till the 21st  of December. Besides exhibiting 92
column3: > artworks and performances by 100 artists from 31 countries, the Festival will host symposiums, educational tours, screenings, residencies, workshops and much more during its running.

column1: Why Earth|Body|Mind?

Nepal, a country primarily known for its geographic features and cultural heritage, is highly dependent on agriculture and its natural resources for the livelihood of its people. Nepal is also home to the third largest ice reserves in the world meaning almost one-third of the world's population is sustained on the water resources stemming from within our borders. As one of the most vulnerable countries to the effects of climate change (The Climate Change Index, ranked Nepal 4th on their list of countries most susceptible to Climate Change in 2010) we feel responsible and obliged to raise a voice.

Earth|Body|Mind recognizes the urgency of this problem, yet allows for a more encompassing reflection. It alludes to interconnectivity and how borad issues like environmental degradation, and climate change can be reflected through different perspectives.
Participating KIAF artists are presenting an aesthetic experience linking these three elements, to challange perspectives and educate viewers.
Click Here to view works by KIAF 2012 Artists.
Vision and Goals:
<ul>
• KIAF aims to reach over 50,000 viewers, to actively engage citizens, communities, the government, various organizations and students in dialogues instigated by the theme of the Festival.

• Over a dozen venues, locations and public spaces will house artworks and installations with a perfessionally curated arrangement. These spaces were chosen to maximize accessibility and the impact of the artwork.
• The Festival will work with schools, colleges and other academic institutions to provide guided tours of the exhibitions.
• KIAF is working with local artists to
• Talks and symposiums will open the Festival, and will feature presentations from participating artists and scholars on various issues.
• KIAF is partnering with alternative-energy groups to curb its own carbon footprint during the course of the Festival and has also implemented many procedures to keep emissions low.
• KIAF will document all aspects of the Festival in both Nepali and English for the purposes of assessment and preservation.
How you can help?

If you are donating, your pledge will be used to cover the costs of the festival (excluding any cost of Human Resources). The total cost of the festival adds up to $160,000 and so far we have raised half the amount. We anticipate recieveing $30,000 in kind and in cash from insitituions within Nepal. So that leaves us with with somewhere around $50,000, of which we are trying to raise alteast half via this online campaign and the rest through local fundraisers. The following are some of the aspects of the Festival you will help fund:
<ul>
• Documentation (catalog, videography, photography etc.)
• Freight Cost of some of the artwork and artists.
• Festival events and performances.*

There are other ways of helping us! Help promote our Festival on social networking sites, our Facebook and Twitter links are below, share them with friends and family. Like our page on Facebook to recieve daily updates and new content delivered to your homescreen. You can also help us build content for our website by writing on our blog about specific artists/artwork and/or issues. Another way you can help is by getting us printed! Write about the festival and pitch your articles to newspapers and magazines, wherever appropriate. There are still other ways you can help. Email us at info@artmandu.org and we can discuss the possibilities.
*A detailed budget report will be published on our website, at the end of the campaign.
**Currently we are working on setting up our Paypal account. We will notify you, when the option becomes available.
What you get in return?

Given the theme of this year’s Festival, we wanted the rewards offered to not only be artistic and creative but environmentally friendly as well. Our pledge rewards will be made using recycled or recyclable materials. From postcards to calendars, all rewards will feature artwork created by participating artists.

On November 1st, KIAF will host a Printmaking Workshop in collaboration with Bindu: A Space for Artists (one of our supporting institutions), through which we hope to provide pledgers with memorable and significant tokens of our appreciation. Prints from the workshop will only be used for our fundraising campaign, meaning each one will be a limited edition artwork created by a Nepali artist just for you. We are also giving away merchandise designed and made by young art graduates.
Our History

The Festival started in 2009 with the mission ""to firmly place Nepal on the global map as a venue for the contemporary arts, allow for artistic collaborations and exchanges among international and local artists, and use art as a platform for critical reflection and the sensitization of society.""
1st Kathmandu International Art Festival:

The 1st KIAF was organized by the Siddartha Art Gallery and held between October 30th  and November 10th. Titled ‘Separating Myth from Reality – Status of Women,’ the festival was spread across six venues in the Kathmandu Valley. The 11-day Festival presented artworks by 111 artists from 25 countries. The festival also hosted a 3-day symposium to discuss issues raised by the Festival’s theme. It was inaugurated by a former Living Goddess (Kumari) Rashmila Shakya, who personified gender-typified roles in Nepali society.
For the augmented vision of the 2nd Festival, the Siddhartha Art Foundation was established (2011) to take it beyond the confines of a gallery
Click Here to see more images from the first Festival.
Our Team

Working with a limited budget has meant our team is mostly made up of volunteers and interns mixed in with a few full-time staff. To support us, artists, art administrators and curators have pitched in hours of helpful insight and resources. Meet our team below:
We are thankful to the following institutions for supporting our Festival:

The Landscape

Drivers across the Missouri interstate often see political billboards or signage with politicized messages. Many messages are anti-abortion, sponsored by conservative Christian groups or right-wing PACS. The nationally acclaimed I-70 Sign Show public-art project has since 2014 installed billboard artworks with a playful nonpartisan mission of sparking conversation around blue-versus-red-state issues. With the presidential election, however, the lack of representation of the “blue” side of that dialogue seems especially pointed. For this reason, the Sign Show is presenting a special installation of artist Aleksandra Mir's ""Keep Abortion Legal.""

The Art

Mir created ""Keep Abortion Legal"" in 2005 in response to the aggressive rhetoric and imagery of anti-abortion protests. Her design is simple: a basic font in pastel hues asserts support for an existing federal law. It is free for anyone to use. Yet this iconic work remains controversial and testifies to how divided the nation is on the issue of abortion. Attempts to display the design in public, institutional or corporate art contexts have been discouraged or cancelled and, as recently as 2016, censored.

Billboard are one of the few places where, offline, we encounter messages that challenge our taste and values. Mir's ""Keep Abortion Legal"" gives the intestate audience a point of view that, so far, does not exist in the billboard landscape. The Sign Show has a special interest in testing the billboard advertising landscape as a true marketplace of ideas. What will happen when a lone pro-choice message stands up with (or against) the dominant ad campaigns of the right wing? 

What We Need

Given President Trump's swift and erratic decision-making and the appointment of conservative Supreme Court Justice Neil Gorsuch, we want to see Mir's work installed by June 1.

The Sign Show has reserved a billboard with a company that supports free speech and will install the Mir artwork. (Two of the three regional and national sign companies we contacted declined to install Keep Abortion Legal for political and religious reasons.)

This artwork, installed in June and July, will be seen by an estimated total of 1 million people.

All we need are the funds to make this happen!

Most of our $7,500 fundraising goal goes toward billboard production and installation.

The rest covers the printing and distribution of bumper stickers, postcards, silkscreen prints, and t-shirts for our supporters, as well as campaign processing fees.

There are NO administrative costs. The artist does NOT ask for any payments or royalties for this work but grants everyone free and unlimited use of this design. Any funds raised beyond our goal go toward having Keep Abortion Legal installed for a longer period in Missouri or, if possible, adding an additional sign for the artwork elsewhere in the Midwest. We sincerely hope you will support this important installation!

$3,200: rental of 16 x 50 foot billboard (1,600 per month)
$2,000: billboard vinyl, printing and installation
$1,500: sticker, postcard, t-shirt, and poster production
$800: crowdfunding fees, reward costs and contingencies

What You Get

Project supporters can receive:

_postcards featuring a photograph of the KEEP ABORTION LEGAL billboard installed on I-70
_limited-edition KEEP ABORTION LEGAL bumper stickers
_limited-edition KEEP ABORTION LEGAL silkscreen prints
_high-quality white t-shirts with the KEEP ABORTION LEGAL slogan

Each of these perks is a mass-produced artwork, published by the I-70 Sign Show project using artist Aleksandra Mir's open-source design. 

And in addition to receiving a collectable piece of art ephemera, you gain the invaluable satisfaction of supporting the arts, women's rights, freedom of expression, and free speech!

The Impact

Every week, an average of 130,000 vehicles will pass the billboard we rent. This means that over two months more than a million people will see the ""Keep Abortion Legal"" artwork! Add to this number a Midwestern context where pro-life messages are rarely—if ever—displayed publicly, and you can calculate the significance of this installation and the power of Mir's design.

PLUS ... even after the billboard is deinstalled, the project continues in the form and distribution of ""Keep Abortion Legal"" postcards, stickers, posters, and t-shirts. Documentation of all aspects of the Aleksandra Mir installation will be featured on the I-70 Sign Show website.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that giving money is not always an option. But there are other ways you can help!

Please share this page with friends and organizations who support free speech, right to privacy, women's rights, and the arts!

Email us at info(at)i70signshow(dot)org for more information or if you have any questions.

Enormous thanks to artist Aleksandra Mir for making her design open source and for participating in the I-70 Sign Show! 

Links:

http://i70signshow.org/
https://www.aleksandramir.info/projects/keep-ab...

Tall Tale Radio, a podcast that, since 2008, has interviewed nearly 200 cartoonists, artists, animators, musicians, and writers, needs your help!  I'm trying to raise money to get a new laptop, some recording equipment upgrades, and hopefully defray some travel costs to the Cons I cover.

I hope if you've enjoyed my show that you can pitch in and help me reach my goal of $3500 to cover these expenses. Take a look at the cool incentives...there's one-of-a-kind original art, amazing signed compilations, CDs of edisodes, all sorts of fun stuff to make it worth your while!

I have a great fanbase, and I hope you'll spread the word so that I can continue bringing you quality interviews with the artists you love and admire!

column2: >
>My name is Wilfried Agricola de
column4: >, German media artist and curator and creator of numerous international projects dealing with “art &amp

column2: >A Virtual Memorial Vilnius 2013 is representing the manifestation of SFC – Shoah Film Collection-  my  international initiative for Peace and Reconciliation dealing with the Holocaust - as a cultural event in Lithuania standing under the Patronage of European Parliament, to take place between 23 September and 1 November 2013 at two venues – Jewish Cultural Center of Vilnius and Regional Museum of Kedainiai (a city close to Vilnius) Due to the current financial crisis, the small budget of  these hosting institutions are only able to realise a kind of minimum project constellation, while for the essential project components, e.g. the interventions, additional funding needs to be found via this funding campaign and your support: funding target $ 15.000.

column4: >are representing a wonderful way, to thank all supporters individually in a very personal way and establish a relation between the project creator and the supporter. For the supporter, it is particularly attractive, that – depending on the Perk value - he can select between different types of art works by artists represented in Shoah Film Collection, like individual video art works on DVD, compilations of 3 or more art videos on one DVD, several photo and digital prints as individual works or edition (5-50), and even some original art works are available as gifts for an higher financial support.

column2: >http://sfc.engad.org/blog/
>The Text for this campaign can additionall be downloaded as PDF in English and German language
>

column1: <h2 class=""MsoNormal""><strong style=""""><span lang=""EN-GB"" style=""font-size: 11.0pt

column2: >On the symbolical date of 27 January 2010, 65th return of he Liberation of the Concentration Camp of Auschwitz -  I launched  SFC -Shoah Film Collection -
column3: >http://sfc.engad,org
column4:
> - an independent art project and international initiative addressed to young generations of artists and filmmakers to deal with the topic of Shoah (Holocaust) and collective trauma caused by totalitarianism by using new technologies and contemporary approaches in order to keep vivid the memory  through sensitizing via art.
Each year on 27 January, a new call for the following year is released resulting meanwhile an outstanding collection of works of art &
column5: moving images, e.g. experimental and documentary art films and videos contributed by more than 50 artists from 14 countries. The deadline for 2013 has been extended to 31 July, thus SFC is still accepting submissions. Regulations and entryform an be found on <a href=""http://www.nmartproject.net/netex/?p=1549"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" title=""Call for entries: SFC - Shoah Film Collection""><span style=""color: blue

column2:
>
In order the present this collection of film and videos to a wider audience, I created a special event structure named "" A Virtual Memorial - Commemorative Interventions"" –
column4: > to be hosted by  institutions of culture and art,  placing SFC - Shoah Film Collection in the context of complementary interventions like lectures, a symposium, international artists meeting, exhibitions, performances, artists presentations and talks, discussions and much more, in order to activate the artists and well as the audience. In this way, the project becomes an important international initiative for peace and reconciliation.

column2:
>
In 2012, I realised the pilot project ""A Virtual Memorial Riga 2012""
column4:
>  under the Patronage of the European Parliament in collaboration with Riga Ghetto and Latvian Holocaust Museum, the Culture Project and Latvian Videoart Archives NOASS Riga and the European funding context ""Artists for Change"" 1-30 June 2012, supported by the Latvian based embassies of USA, Sweden, Austria and Israel. The documentation can be reviewed online on http://ateamartistsforchange.wordpress.com/category/latvian-category/

With this crowdfunding campaign, I would like invite you to help me to realise the manifestation of SFC _ Shoah Film Collection in Lithuania as ""A Virtual Memorial Vilnius 2013"" – to take place between 23 September and 1 November 2013 - standing again under the Patronage of the European Parliament - a collaboration with Jewish Cultural Center Vilnius and the Regional Museum of Kedainiai (a city close to Vilnius).

column2: >
>The opening of the project is scheduled for the
column4: >, the national memorial day for the Lithuanian victims of the Holocaust, the inauguration of exhibitions featuring films and videos and their making of, photographs and digital graphics. The international artists’ meeting and symposium will take place on 24-27 September 2013, including screenings,  lectures, artists presentations and talks, discussions and other interventions like the performances by Doron Polak and Arturas Bumsteinas (Lithuanian sound artist). On 1 October, the project &
column5: the meeting of artists will move to the Regional Museum of Kedainiai, a former synagogue which was not destroyed by the Nazis, to be followed by the lectures, artists’ presentations and talks screenings and discussions on 2-4 October 2013.

column1: <h2 class=""MsoNormal""><strong style=""""><span style=""font-size: 11.0pt

column2: >For most people living these days, the Holocaust does not mean anything else than historical Past which does not affect them personally, at all. The project of Shoah Film Collection  and its manifestations would like to sensitize, motivate and activate people, in order to enable an identification, personal connection and affection by entering a new approach making them recognize that the Holocaust should  actually affecting everybody from the bottom of their heart, because it is representing in fact the most horrible manifestation of what we call the „dark side of human nature“, which may manifest itself in its lightest forms in most different ways already in everyone’s life in family, school and education through intolerance and discrimination, for instance.

SFC _ Shoah Film Collection and its manifestations, and especially the most recent one in Vilnius/ Lithuania may be the cause to start or continue working on that the Holocaust and other crimes against humanity must not happen again.

Hello, my name is Wilfried Agricola de Cologne ( you see me on the image above as the 2nd from the left, together with the SFC artists collegues attending A Virtual Memorial Riga 2012 - on the left standing Felice Hapetzeder, and on the right Eitan Vitkon, Shelley Jordon, Jay Needham, Ben Neufeld and Doron Polak), I am an interdisciplinary media artist and cúrator and initiator of  SFC _ Shoah Film Collection. The way, how I described my project as “community based”, not only my person, but all partners are standing behind this project  who were accompanying the project until now, they are: the hosts in 2011 in St.Petersburg (Russia), Szeszin (Poland), Arad (Romania), 2012 in Riga (Latvia) Warsaw (Poland), und Phnom Penh (Cambodia) und 2013 in Vilnius und Kedainiai (Lithuania) and project sponsors Zenith Art Systems Bonn (Germany) und Karthäuser &
column3: Breuer Cologne (Germany), but above all the community of artists participating in SFC – Shoah Film Collection, without them the project wouldn’t exist, including…..

column1: ","Short description
My name is Wilfried Agricola de Cologne, German media artist and curator and creator of numerous international projects dealing with “art & moving images”.

A Virtual Memorial Vilnius 2013 is representing the manifestation of SFC – Shoah Film Collection-  my  international initiative for Peace and Reconciliation dealing with the Holocaust - as a cultural event in Lithuania standing under the Patronage of European Parliament, to take place between 23 September and 1 November 2013 at two venues – Jewish Cultural Center of Vilnius and Regional Museum of Kedainiai (a city close to Vilnius) Due to the current financial crisis, the small budget of  these hosting institutions are only able to realise a kind of minimum project constellation, while for the essential project components, e.g. the interventions, additional funding needs to be found via this funding campaign and your support: funding target $ 15.000.

The “Perks"" are representing a wonderful way, to thank all supporters individually in a very personal way and establish a relation between the project creator and the supporter. For the supporter, it is particularly attractive, that – depending on the Perk value - he can select between different types of art works by artists represented in Shoah Film Collection, like individual video art works on DVD, compilations of 3 or more art videos on one DVD, several photo and digital prints as individual works or edition (5-50), and even some original art works are available as gifts for an higher financial support.
http://sfc.engad.org/blog/
The Text for this campaign can additionall be downloaded as PDF in English and German language
About

On the symbolical date of 27 January 2010, 65th return of he Liberation of the Concentration Camp of Auschwitz -  I launched  SFC -Shoah Film Collection -  http://sfc.engad,org - an independent art project and international initiative addressed to young generations of artists and filmmakers to deal with the topic of Shoah (Holocaust) and collective trauma caused by totalitarianism by using new technologies and contemporary approaches in order to keep vivid the memory  through sensitizing via art. Each year on 27 January, a new call for the following year is released resulting meanwhile an outstanding collection of works of art & moving images, e.g. experimental and documentary art films and videos contributed by more than 50 artists from 14 countries. The deadline for 2013 has been extended to 31 July, thus SFC is still accepting submissions. Regulations and entryform an be found on http://www.nmartproject.net/netex/?p=1549

In order the present this collection of film and videos to a wider audience, I created a special event structure named "" A Virtual Memorial - Commemorative Interventions"" – http://avmci.a-virtual-memorial.org to be hosted by  institutions of culture and art,  placing SFC - Shoah Film Collection in the context of complementary interventions like lectures, a symposium, international artists meeting, exhibitions, performances, artists presentations and talks, discussions and much more, in order to activate the artists and well as the audience. In this way, the project becomes an important international initiative for peace and reconciliation.

In 2012, I realised the pilot project ""A Virtual Memorial Riga 2012"" http://riga2012.a-virtual-memorial.org  under the Patronage of the European Parliament in collaboration with Riga Ghetto and Latvian Holocaust Museum, the Culture Project and Latvian Videoart Archives NOASS Riga and the European funding context ""Artists for Change"" 1-30 June 2012, supported by the Latvian based embassies of USA, Sweden, Austria and Israel. The documentation can be reviewed online on http://ateamartistsforchange.wordpress.com/category/latvian-category/ With this crowdfunding campaign, I would like invite you to help me to realise the manifestation of SFC _ Shoah Film Collection in Lithuania as ""A Virtual Memorial Vilnius 2013"" – to take place between 23 September and 1 November 2013 - standing again under the Patronage of the European Parliament - a collaboration with Jewish Cultural Center Vilnius and the Regional Museum of Kedainiai (a city close to Vilnius).

The opening of the project is scheduled for the 23 September 2013, the national memorial day for the Lithuanian victims of the Holocaust, the inauguration of exhibitions featuring films and videos and their making of, photographs and digital graphics. The international artists’ meeting and symposium will take place on 24-27 September 2013, including screenings,  lectures, artists presentations and talks, discussions and other interventions like the performances by Doron Polak and Arturas Bumsteinas (Lithuanian sound artist). On 1 October, the project & the meeting of artists will move to the Regional Museum of Kedainiai, a former synagogue which was not destroyed by the Nazis, to be followed by the lectures, artists’ presentations and talks screenings and discussions on 2-4 October 2013.
Aims and target audience

For most people living these days, the Holocaust does not mean anything else than historical Past which does not affect them personally, at all. The project of Shoah Film Collection  and its manifestations would like to sensitize, motivate and activate people, in order to enable an identification, personal connection and affection by entering a new approach making them recognize that the Holocaust should  actually affecting everybody from the bottom of their heart, because it is representing in fact the most horrible manifestation of what we call the „dark side of human nature“, which may manifest itself in its lightest forms in most different ways already in everyone’s life in family, school and education through intolerance and discrimination, for instance.

SFC _ Shoah Film Collection and its manifestations, and especially the most recent one in Vilnius/ Lithuania may be the cause to start or continue working on that the Holocaust and other crimes against humanity must not happen again.
Why should this project be supported?

Because it is unique in its kind as an art project, because so many serious creative people are involved, because an artistic discussion about essential issues in art and life is needed, because the European Parliament is honouring this project realisation in Lithuania by taking Patronage speaking  - even if probably not for all Europeans -  but for the majority of them in any case, because the existence of man kind is requiring a re-thinking of human values, because we are one people, no matter on which continent under  which historical, political, economical, ethnic, cultural, religious conditions we are living, because the event in Lithuania will give thousands of positive signals, because it will make the future manifestation at other places possible……..
*Because in Greece there are now Neo-Nazis in the Parliament - *because it is good for artists to get there and meet in person with each other and have discussions with the public.
*Because a younger generation has no memory or historical knowledge of the holocaust
*Because Lithuania has an intensely anti-Semitic past, maybe present too, and i am very interested in showing my work there. (Annetta Kapon, USA)

As new generations grow up, without personal experience of meeting witnesses, perpetrators or surviving victims of the Holocaust, we need to build new kinds of memorials, archives and create new artworks to continue and deepen the research of how the atrocities could ever be permitted to occur. Agricola de Cologne’s Shoah Film Collection is an important instance of such an institution. If the exhibition and archive, with all it represents, would not receive it’s rightful place within contemporary consciousness, it would be a great loss. This is a unique opportunity to discuss the ever-important issue of Holocaust with the Lithuanian public. Don’t let it be lost. You can help us realize SFC - Shoah Film Collection in Vilnius."" (Felice Hapetzeder, Sweden)
One of the reasons is because this project is not a commercial project and the artists involved are not represented by a commercial gallery. (Ariel Yannay Shani, Israel)
Because, for very personal reasons, that go far beyond the work that I shall be showing.

At the end of the 19th century, looking for a better life, wishing to escape the pogroms, an important part of the Jewish population left Lithuania for South Africa and founded a new community there. These are my origins, we are the ones who survived. During the war, my father and many other South African Jews returned to Europe in the Allied armies, to fight Nazism. Many other South African Jews took up the fight against Apartheid.

This event, the Shoah Film Collection in Vilnius, is important to commemorate those who were lost, but also to commemorate and celebrate us, the survivors, who refused to lie down and die, but who fight for a better, kinder, more generous world for all.(Joseph Rabie, France)
Because.... Humanity is cruel and stubborn. The Holocaust can never be commemorated enough. (T&NOK - Bannenberg &Snel, Netherlands)
Because.... the Holocaust should always be remembered as the biggest human crime.
Because…We say to all generations to come ""NEVER AGAIN""
Because …it is the worst historic fact in the last century, when Europe was already a well civilized country...(Dova Cahan ,Israel)
*Because it's important not to forget, - *because man usually repeat his mistakes,
*because history never teaches us how to be best, if we are not able to transform bad events into beauty (Isobel Bank, Italy)

""In no other place nor time did one witness a phenomenon so sudden and so complex: never were so many human lives extinguished in so little time, and with such an equally lucid mixture of technical intelligence, fanaticism, and cruelty"".--Primo Levi The Holocaust presents a profound challenge to memorialization. A group of international artists have created work as a way to preserve and honor the memory  of victims of the Holocaust. We have the opportunity for this work to be shown in Vilna in September 2013, where it will seize attention and attract debate to the new generations. We need your support to materialize this opportunity that will help to encourage awareness and remind us of the threat posed to us all when genocide and crimes against humanity are allowed to occur. (Alicia Felberbaum, UK)

The Shoah Film Collection is a vitally important series of media art works that collectively expresses the critical connections between art and historic memory. This is a collection that actively calls on generations to remember not only the atrocities of war but also requires us to consider how these inherited memories are translated into art. (Jay Needham, USA)
How will the raised funding be used?

The funding target of  $15 000 is representing just a kind of minimal budget, while in reality more than the double amount would be needed. The status of this project as a non-profit, internationally orientated media art project from Germany dealing with the Holocaust to be realised in Lithuania makes it difficult to raise any funding from anywhere.

One needs to consider, that due to the financial crisis the  Lithuanian institutions hosting this project are only able to provide a very small budget, which allows just the realisation of a kind of minimal constellation. After numerous of the Vilnius based embassies confirmed the financial support for artists to attend the project event, this project will be realised in any case in such a minimal constellation, while for the realisation of advanced essential components additional funding has to be raised via this crowdfunding campaign.

The fact, however, that the project realisation will take place in any case is of particular relevance for all those who would like to support this project, because already from the beginning there is the guarantee that each incoming cent will be used for the project realisation in Lithuania.

After a community of artists is carrying this initiative together with me, from my point of view the best perspectives - also in terms of the aims as an international initiative for Peace and Reconciliation – are to get the international community of supporters on board which show simultaneously their solidarity that the Holocaust, genocides and other crimes against humanity, intolerance, discrimination, persecution and torture must not happen again. Never More!
According to the priority of the project realisation, the incoming money will be spent exclusively for the realisation of not yet financed project components, e.g.

1. the preparations in Cologne: print of a multilingual brochure and  leaflets in German, English and Lithuanian , print & preparations of the photographic, digital graphic, computer based works, films and videos  for the exhibitions in Vilnius (23. Sept – 1. November 2013) und Kedainai (1. Oktober – 1. November 2013), transport Cologne-Vilnius-Cologne,

2. preparations in Lithuania: (Vilnius/Kedainiai) installation of exhibitions: SFC – Shoah Film Collection, photographs and grafics, computer based multimedia works  - hiring technical and electronic equipment for the duration of the exhibitions, eg. projectors, DVD players, flatscreens, computers etc for the duration of the exhibitions. Performance: Doron Polak, Arthuras Bumsteinas and group: hiring of sound, light and electronic equipment, fees.
3. The remaining money will be used for covering expenses like meetings including international and local artists, accommodation and stay for artists etc. in Vilnius &  Kedainiai
If this funding target of  $15 000 should be exceeded, according to the priority some additional project components will be realised, e.g.

4. inviting one or more additional artists for covering expenses like travel & accommodation, which was not possible until now, 5. including a third venue - the Museum Fort VII in Kaunas  (the first concentration camp on Lithuanian ground at the 2nd largest Lithuanian city) a potential partner, which would like to join, but has no budget at all, at least $ 4000  would be needed to cover the event expenses on 5 & 6 October 2013 – an international artists meeting including screenings, artists presentations and talks, discussions
column2: 6. it is further intended to produce and print afterwards a catalogue documenting the project realisation in Lithuania, which is of particular relevance.

The way, how I described my project as “community based”, not only my person, but all partners are standing behind this project  who were accompanying the project until now, they are: the hosts in 2011 in St.Petersburg (Russia), Szeszin (Poland), Arad (Romania), 2012 in Riga (Latvia) Warsaw (Poland), und Phnom Penh (Cambodia) und 2013 in Vilnius und Kedainiai (Lithuania) and project sponsors Zenith Art Systems Bonn (Germany) und Karthäuser & Breuer Cologne (Germany), but above all the community of artists participating in SFC – Shoah Film Collection, without them the project wouldn’t exist, including…..

The “Perks

It is necessary to add a note concerning the serial art works like the artvideos and the photographic and digital prints. The artvideos are given to the supporters as copies, the supporter does not receive any rights on the work, he may use the video (s) for private use only. Any other use, for instance, public screening requires the expressive permission by the artist or owner of the respective work. The average price for the unlimited copy of an artvideo on the market is about 100 EURO ($ 132).

The serial prints are released on occasion of this campaign in special editions and different sizes and are all numbered and signed by the artist. The delivery of these “Perks” may take more time than usual, since the period of the project realisation within 6 weeks after the campaign deadline is very short.",20.0,0,"1 Campaign

Indigenous Experience NW2013
We here at Petite Taway inc. and  Ravenwolf NDN Arts are raising funds to produce an Indigenous Art show and much more in Portland, Oregon on May 30th, 2013.

A vision came between an emerging indigenous artist(TJ Ravenwolf AKA: Datson Teekkona) and a new company(Petite Taway inc., Deborah Newman) trying to break into the art scene while acknowledging the lack of presence and representation of the Indigenous community in Portland, Oregon.

The theme of  this year’s event is “Medicine Within” and focuses on the many ways we heal  ourselves, heal our families, and heal our communities by bringing forward our individual  (and/or collective) talents, skills, and trades . . . and by engaging our own  “Medicine Within.”

Deborah met TJ, in late 2011, and became his art representative in 2012. Deborah and TJ used art as a form of healing and growth the past year, to overcome major roadblocks in their lives. Trying to come up with ideas on how to create an art show for TJ, the idea of bringing in the community was integrated, so it not only became an art show, but an ""Indigenous Experience"". These ideas tried to solve these questions:
<ul>
• How to introduce, honor, and celebrate native art and culture to a new audience in the Portland area?
<li>How to introduce  an emerging artist into the art market which has a huge disparity in native presence &amp
• With this  event how could we include, involve, and give back to the community? Having community exhibitor's bring and share their medicine.
• How to integrate the spirit and medicine of the community into TJ's art show?

Thus the vision of ""Indigenous Experience NW 2013 "" event was born. This event is a collaboration between: artists, musical performers, speakers, traditional storytellers, and exhibitors that would encourage the general public to interact and learn about local native culture. Traditional native food would also be available as part of the experience.
So May 30th, 2013 the event will take place and both Deborah and TJ hope that with the success of the event, events on the East coast(DC) and NW will happen on a yearly basis.

This vision of spirit with the hope of many healing journeys coming together that is becoming a reality in this world has NO corporate sponsership or funding from outside sources. The planning commitee and event staff are all volunteer's from the local community donating their time to support this endeavour.
This year we have as Musical performer's, four Native American Music Awards(NAMA) winners... *""Keith Secola"", *""Swil Kanim"", *""Cody Blackbird"", and *""Double Feature, Bigg B &
column2: N8"", all backed by local/regional hero's the ""*Brain Harrison Trio"".

column1: For the Speaker's we have the respected  *""Lillian Pitt"", *""Rick Bartow"", *""Charleen Touchette"", *""Phillip Archambeau"", *""Jubel Perkins"" and possibly a few more.
So far for Story Teller's we have the great *""Ed Edmo"" and are awaiting confirmation from others.
We have invited Many local community organizations to come and exhibit who they are and what the contribute to the community.
<div>
What We Need
We must raise $7,000 to help pay for the the following:
*Scottish Rites Center venue(Ballroom and Auditorium).
*Fees/Honorariums, transportation, housing, meals of Performer's, Story Teller's, and Speaker's.
*Advertising/Marketing.
*Catering.
*Sound Reinforcement and equipment rentals.
*Audio/video production.
*Art, event, and stage material/construction displays.
<div>
The Impact
This event could be seen as an artshow, a community fair, or a fesitval of some sorts... we have chosen to go with this all as an Indigenous ""Experience"".
The pulling together and inviting all arts, culture, and healing elements of the community to pray, celebrate, honor and heal to be present and say WE are here!  ALL under one roof in one night!

The funds raised here is soley for the production and inherent costs of this event. NONE of the funds will be for individual benefit or compensation. Part of the proceeds will go to benefit the Traditional Games Clinics in Portland, OR.
We here at Petite Taway inc., Ravenwolf NDN Arts, and the local volunteers are excited and ready! We hope to have your support! Thank you very much!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us promote this event by sharing and inviting all people's by following the links below!
http://indigenousexperiencenw.com/
http://petitetaway.com
http://ravenwolfndnarts.com/
please feel free to contact us for any suggestions that may inhance this experience!
Thanks again for your time, energy, and support!
We hope to see you there!
","Indigenous Experience NW2013
We here at Petite Taway inc. and  Ravenwolf NDN Arts are raising funds to produce an Indigenous Art show and much more in Portland, Oregon on May 30th, 2013.

A vision came between an emerging indigenous artist(TJ Ravenwolf AKA: Datson Teekkona) and a new company(Petite Taway inc., Deborah Newman) trying to break into the art scene while acknowledging the lack of presence and representation of the Indigenous community in Portland, Oregon.

The theme of  this year’s event is “Medicine Within” and focuses on the many ways we heal  ourselves, heal our families, and heal our communities by bringing forward our individual  (and/or collective) talents, skills, and trades . . . and by engaging our own  “Medicine Within.”

Deborah met TJ, in late 2011, and became his art representative in 2012. Deborah and TJ used art as a form of healing and growth the past year, to overcome major roadblocks in their lives. Trying to come up with ideas on how to create an art show for TJ, the idea of bringing in the community was integrated, so it not only became an art show, but an ""Indigenous Experience"". These ideas tried to solve these questions:
How to introduce, honor, and celebrate native art and culture to a new audience in the Portland area?
How to introduce  an emerging artist into the art market which has a huge disparity in native presence & representaton?
With this  event how could we include, involve, and give back to the community? Having community exhibitor's bring and share their medicine.
How to integrate the spirit and medicine of the community into TJ's art show?

Thus the vision of ""Indigenous Experience NW 2013 "" event was born. This event is a collaboration between: artists, musical performers, speakers, traditional storytellers, and exhibitors that would encourage the general public to interact and learn about local native culture. Traditional native food would also be available as part of the experience.
So May 30th, 2013 the event will take place and both Deborah and TJ hope that with the success of the event, events on the East coast(DC) and NW will happen on a yearly basis.

This vision of spirit with the hope of many healing journeys coming together that is becoming a reality in this world has NO corporate sponsership or funding from outside sources. The planning commitee and event staff are all volunteer's from the local community donating their time to support this endeavour.

This year we have as Musical performer's, four Native American Music Awards(NAMA) winners... *""Keith Secola"", *""Swil Kanim"", *""Cody Blackbird"", and *""Double Feature, Bigg B & N8"", all backed by local/regional hero's the ""*Brain Harrison Trio"".
For the Speaker's we have the respected  *""Lillian Pitt"", *""Rick Bartow"", *""Charleen Touchette"", *""Phillip Archambeau"", *""Jubel Perkins"" and possibly a few more.
So far for Story Teller's we have the great *""Ed Edmo"" and are awaiting confirmation from others.
We have invited Many local community organizations to come and exhibit who they are and what the contribute to the community.
What We Need
We must raise $7,000 to help pay for the the following:
*Scottish Rites Center venue(Ballroom and Auditorium).
*Fees/Honorariums, transportation, housing, meals of Performer's, Story Teller's, and Speaker's.
*Advertising/Marketing.
*Catering.
*Sound Reinforcement and equipment rentals.
*Audio/video production.
*Art, event, and stage material/construction displays.
The Impact
This event could be seen as an artshow, a community fair, or a fesitval of some sorts... we have chosen to go with this all as an Indigenous ""Experience"".
The pulling together and inviting all arts, culture, and healing elements of the community to pray, celebrate, honor and heal to be present and say WE are here!  ALL under one roof in one night!

The funds raised here is soley for the production and inherent costs of this event. NONE of the funds will be for individual benefit or compensation. Part of the proceeds will go to benefit the Traditional Games Clinics in Portland, OR.
We here at Petite Taway inc., Ravenwolf NDN Arts, and the local volunteers are excited and ready! We hope to have your support! Thank you very much!
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us promote this event by sharing and inviting all people's by following the links below!
http://indigenousexperiencenw.com/
http://petitetaway.com
http://ravenwolfndnarts.com/
please feel free to contact us for any suggestions that may inhance this experience!
Thanks again for your time, energy, and support!
We hope to see you there!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Portland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/indigenous-experience-nw2013/pica

Short Summary
Quantum Shanti Art Studio is a non-profit corporation in Ontario, Canada that serves member artists and supports local arts in general.
As a non-profit corporation any revenue from art sales are reinvested in artists and the community. When you invest in art, you invest in artists
column2: when you invest in artists you invest in a better world.

column1: This campaign seeks to support member artists to support local youth. A one day workshop will see members volunteer to provide mentorship to local youth. Art supplies will be provided, and the venue will be a local community centre in downtown Ottawa such as the Bronson Centre. The youth art will be featured in an online art show, with promotion!
<h3>What We Need &amp
$2500 will provide for 70 youth participants ages 8-16 to participate in a one day art workship with supplies, snacks and lunch provided.
Resulting art will be photographed and a promoted online exhibit of the artwork will occur in late January/early February 2013.
If we don't reach our entire goal we will still do a winter youth workshop and art show, but at a lesser scale.
The Impact
Art matters! Canadian art matters! By using social media everyone is invited, everyone can turn their attention for a moment to original art rather than mass produced department store prints.

Quantum Shanti Art Studio had its first online art show December 1-6, 2012 on facebook, and attracted over 100,000 visitors from 50 countries and over 11,000 ""likes"". Another winter show is contemplated based on a winter painting session.
Up to 70 local youth artists can have their first worldwide art exhibit.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please, you can still help! Please consider contributing by:
<ul>
• Check out our art on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/QuantumShantiArtStudio - remember to LIKE us and our paintings!
• Volunteer at the Quantum Shanti Jr. Art Workshop- please contact kate@quantumshanti.com
• If you are a youth in the downtown Ottawa area get in touch to participate! We are on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/QuantumShantiArtStudio
• Buy our paintings on etsy.com at http://www.etsy.com/shop/QuantumShanti?ref=search_shop_redirect
• Share our paintings with others that you think might appreciate them.

Thanks!

WE MADE IT - but you can still get your copy !!!
WOW! Our fundraiser for “book I’M” reached it’s €8,000 goal. I wanted to extend a huge THANK YOU to everyone who donated, or helped spread the message!
BUT - you can still get your book copy here: http://www.martinstranka.com/book.html
ABOUT ME and MY BOOK:
After such amazing and adventurous 5 years art journey I finally decided it's time to turn all my photos into unique thing - a beautiful art book. And I need your help to realise the photo book.

My name is Martin Stranka. I am a self-taught professional photographer. My distinctive vision of photography etched as a unique space located in a balance and serenity, while my sophisticated images exists in that narrow space of a few seconds between dreaming and awakening.

During the last 3 years I have gathered over 40 international awards from different competitions including Professional Photographer of the Year, Sony World Photography Awards or International Photo Award.
More about my work: www.martinstranka.com
If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me via my email: stranka.martin@gmail.com
And this is me :-)
WHAT I NEED TO PUBLISH THE BOOK ?

My goal is to publish a limited edition book. To do this I need to raise at least 8,000 EUR. The more money I raise the nicer the book can be. Many details during printing and binding separate a good book from a great book and I want this to be a great book. I am setting a goal of 8,000 EUR because this is what I think I am capable of raising.

The major risk in this project is not getting funded. Indiegogo is all or none, so if the 8,000 EUR goal isn't reached, I won't get any of the funding toward the books. I will need to place a bulk order in order to keep the costs low.
I want you to love this book as much as I do.
HOW CAN YOU DONATE and GET YOUR OWN BOOK ?

You can donate with your typical credit cards (Visa and Mastercard) or with PayPal account. So it is so easy for everyone :-) The Perks you get for your contribution are on the right side (8 grey rectangles).
If the 8,000 EUR goal isn't reached, all accumulated money will be immediately sent back to your account. So you can't lose anything.
HOW THE BOOK WILL LOOK LIKE ?

I found an amazing book printer right here in Czech republic which published book for world known photographers, so I could not be luckier. They specialize in beautiful photography books, and I will be working with them one on one to create a high quality art book. It will be a hardcover gem that will really hold its own on bookshelves and coffee tables, and it will feature all of my favorite images from my last 5 years. All books will be numbered and personally signed as a limited edition. I plan to publish the book after this crowdfunding project.
Here is a book preview:
WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION ?

While the book itself will be the main goal and the reward for the  € 29 and higher levels, I am also offering a Collectors Box, small prints and beautiful museum archival grand prints up to 100x100cm from my portfolio, personally signed and numbered (edition of 25). Read more about each of these rewards to the right. If the 8,000 EUR goal is reached all rewards (all prints and collector's box) will be immediately sent at the end. All books will be sent immediately after publishing the book (during the second/third quarter of the year 2013).
Rewards Preview:
50x50cm (20x20in) museum archival print ""Rejected""
Collector's Box (including 20 photos, signed and certified):
THE IMAGES:
Below are just a few of the images from the book:
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT:
If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please send this link along to your friends and family on facebook, twitter or just to your email contacts who you think might be interested in supporting me.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

have you ever tried to imagine what <font color=""red"">red</font>
color does look like? Have you ever wondered how difficult it must be
for someone who never has and never will see any color?
Hello everyone!
Thank you
for finding time to have a look at our campaign.
Let's start with some numbers:
650,000,000 - this is the approximate number of disabled
people living today
15% of them declares painting and sculpturing to be their
passion
100,000,000 is the number of active disabled artists, whose
works have never seen the daylight
Would you like to change it?
What is
our project about?
Artots is the name that comes from Art of the Soul. I have been
working with disabled people for few years now. Before that I was not
aware how important role in their life plays the art. For many of
them this is the only way to communicate with the world, others feel
appreciated and needed. We have to remember that their financial
position is sometimes very difficult. There are countries around our
world were disabled people do not receive as much support as they
need.  Artots wants to change it.
Our project is dedicated to all disabled
artists who want to manifest their talents and sometimes even just
presence. I have come to the conclusion that it is not enough to
organize a charity event where they can occasionally present and sell
their work. That helps only some of them without any regularity.
Artots online gallery is supposed to be the place where disabled
artists can display their work and sell it. They have proven to me
that there is no such term as “disabled” when it comes to art.
Let them prove it to the world as well! The main idea behind the
project is creating the possibility to gain finances for their
activity. Every one of them needs tools, sometimes especially
designed for their needs. If they are given an opportunity to
sell their work regularly, they will be given a chance to continue
their work and enjoy their lives, regardless numerous turbulence they
have to face on daily basis. Disabled athletes
have their Para Olympics. Let's create Art Gallery for disabled
artists as well!
What is
our aim?
It is very simple. www.artots.com
will be the place where they can publish their work
to the world. It does not matter whether
it is a painting, a sculpture or any other piece of art.
Regardless if the artists are using their mouth, feet or hands
to create, they will be capable of sharing their passions with
millions all around the world. This unique gallery will be the place
where they can also sell their work and earn money for further work
or medical treatment and physiotherapy -
Anything that can make their life better. Atrots
is a non-profit organization. Not a
single artist will be charged for displaying their work. All
money is kept by them. This is how we want to help. This is our way
of changing the world for better. At least one aspect of it.
Can you
help?
The money that we will gather will be spent on creating the fully
functioning online art gallery. So far we have created Beta Version
of our service, Facebook Application Beta Version and we also have
contacted the disabled artists and collected their work that will be
displayed and offered as our perks if you decide to help our project
become reality. Crowdfunding is the best method of
providing support for our ideas, moreover,
it makes people aware of the problem.
If you can not support us financially we encourage you to spread the
project using social media and tell as many people as possible about
it. Any form of support means a lot for our artists. Together we can
give them the chance to defeat many barriers that make their life
even more difficult.  Please note that this project
is not just a Christmas event that will finish in January. Although
we have chosen to start our campaign before Christmas to give you the
chance to use your perks as Christmas e-cards which you can send to
your family and friends, this is a long term plan which will help
change the life of many for better. The main reasons we gather money
for are:
<ul>
<li>
the online service www.artots.com
<li>
the Facebook App http://artots.com/facebookapp
<li>
the marketing campaign
<li>
art tools for the artists
<li>
current expenses related to the gallery
functioning
As you can see, we need quite a lot of money to
make it all happen. The exact breakdown is done below.
What happens to the money?
Just have a look on how much is possible with your help!
This estimation is based on the
real cost of every aspect of our initiative.
We went for the Flexible Founding, here at Indiegogo. Every single
Dollar will be invested in our project. It depends on you guys how
much we can spend, how big percentage of our plan will be achieved.
So far we have spent our personal budget for the layout, Facebook
Application Beta Version and gathered the pieces of art from the
disabled artists. We still need to create the fully functioning
online service, Facebook Application final version and the mobile
Artots app. We need your help in order to make this all happen. The
artists need your help to make their lives better. Let's make future
worth waiting for all those who we can inspire! Let's appreciate
their efforts!
If we gather …
<ul>
<li>
More than $125,000 we will complete the online service, the
Facebook App and the mobile version. The service will be available
in 23 languages. It will be supported by the worldwide marketing
campaign. Fully working and recognizable service will be operating
in December 2014 and the FB App will be available in February 2015.
<li>
More than $85,000
but less than the above, we will complete the online service, the
Facebook App and the mobile version. The service will be available
in 23 languages. It will be done the same time as above.
<li>
More than $55,000
but less than the above, we will complete the online service and the
mobile version. The service will be available in 23 languages. It
will be done the same time as above.
<li>
More than $45,000 but
less than the above, we will complete the online service available
in 23 languages. It will be done in November 2014.
<li>
More than $40,000
but less than the above, we will complete the online service
available in English, German, French, Spanish and Polish. This money
will cover the cost of creating and running it.
<b>Less than
$40,000, we will provide
art tools such as paint, paper, brushes, easels designed for
disabled people and everything else, that such artist may require in
order to create. This money will be enough to help 1000 artists. The
due date for the dispatch of all goods is April 2014. Please note,
that any extra money we have left, regardless the final amount, will
also be donated for such cause. Let's help as much as we can!
<ol>
<li>
Fully
functional online gallery creation. It will be located at
www.artots.com and
it will be a very special place where disabled people can display
and sell their art.
<li>
Facebook Application. Such application will be available to everyone
who wants to display their paintings in Facebook. You
will be able to share the paintings with all your friends in

Facebook.
Here is what it will look like: http://artots.com/facebookapp
3) Worldwide marketing campaign to make people aware of the new
chance that has appeared. All disabled artists will be capable of
presenting their art. If they only want, there will be no borders
nor limits in their Art of the Soul promotion.
What will it work like?
We have many ideas about the way we would like the gallery to
operate. Here they are:
<ol>
<li>
Paintings will be available in electronic or traditional version.
You can request any that you like to be done by the chosen artist
with the chosen method. You can even request a painting to be done
for your individual request. All electronic replicas will be
available as .jpg files ready to put into the FB app, wallpapers,
screensavers, e-cards, posters, paper and canvas replicas or
original issues. Any .jpg image will be fully convertible to other
formats so that transferring it to canvas was easy and manageable.
All paintings come from limited collection. They are not an effect
of any sort of mass production.
<li>
Sculptures will be sold in their original form or made to order by
the chosen artist.
All people who decide to support us
financially will receive the unique code for their paintings as well
as for their Certificate of the 21<sup>st</sup>
Century Artots Patron of Art. Using your personal code you will be
able to take part in discussion forums that will decide over the
further Artots development. You will receive such authority by
becoming Artots co-founder.
Everybody is the
winner!
Here, at Artots we believe that every person involved in our activity
is the winner. From the very beginning they make a contribution into
making this project successful. Here is the benefit breakdown:
<b style=""line-height: 1.45em

column2: >How long does it take to receive my perk?

column1: <li>
All perks 1 – 9 will be  delivered within 1 to 5 days. We will not
be waiting for the campaign to finish. You will receive a link which
will take you to the download section instantly.
Delivering perks 9 – 12 takes longer as they are not
„manufactured”. These are the effect of a disabled artist's
handwork. After you have decided to get one of them, we will notify
you via email about it expected time of delivery.  Please note, the
artist whose picture you have chosen will put a lot of effort to
make this work a real masterpiece so that you could enjoy not only
the picture itself, but the fact you have supported someone just as
gifted as life experienced.
<li>
What is the Certificate and how to become Artots Patron of Art?
Every
co-founder, regardless the perk value receives Artots
Patron of Art Certificate. Artots Patron of Art,who
we also call The 21<sup>st</sup>
Century Patron of Art, is any person of good will who decides to
contribute into our idea implementation. Such person has proven
their concern for the disabled artists fate and wants to help them
create a place where they could enjoy their lives the way they
appreciate it the most. All of you can become the Artots Patron of
Art.
<li>
<b style=""line-height: 1.45em
is the unique number for every single Artots co-founder. Each
picture, certificate or card has been given this unrepeatable
number. You can be certain that each image you have received is
unique, original and it will last forever in the history of modern
art. On top of that the number will also allow for expressing
yourself in special co-founders' forum which has been designed so
that all of us could decide over
development's path.
<li>
<b style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >How do you know which perk I want and how I want it to be made?

column1: It
is simple! All details of the chosen perk will have to be specified
in an email sent to: info@artots.com

Here are few examples of possible options:

*
After
choosing your perk you need to email us with the perk's ID which you
can find at www.artots.com
and tell us the email address you want to have it sent to.
* Also if it is a paper or canvas replica you will have to tell us
the exact address for the delivery.
* If you choose an e-card you need to tell us which one it was.
* If you choose the wishes from our gallery you will have to tell us
the wishes number.
* If you want to have your own wishes on the card, please email them
to us and we will place it on your card.
<li>
How much are the shipment costs and where do you deliver?
No matter where you are from, we will deliver your perk without any
extra charges. We fully appreciate your support to our action,
therefore, we do not see any reason to charge you extra for the act
of good will.
<li>
Limited collection paintings. Where do they come from?
Those
paintings come directly from the disabled artists. It was their
input into www.artots.com
development.
<li>
Which electronic format my paintings will be delivered in?
It
will be .jpg format ready to place your picture in your FB gallery.
What is more, if we gather $85,000 we will create special FB
application which will allow for convenient management of your own
21st century FB art gallery. You
will receive a link which will help you download the package with
your paintings, cards and the certificate. It will be delivered to
your email address.
In
case of any further questions we will be happy to answer them asap
via email.You
may also look for further info on our web site www.artots.com
and follow us on Facebook. In case of any doubts, please do not
hesitate and write to us on info@artots.com

10 Principles
We
believe in certain rules that let us be who we are. That led us to
creation of the codex of our own. Here is the Artots 10 Principles.
This is the set of 10 most significant priorities for our Disabled
Artists Art Gallery.
<li>
All
money that we gather is spent to improve the disabled artists being.
Thanks to your help they will be given a chance to paint and sell
their work worldwide.
<li>
All
perks are delivered free of charge.
<li>
Every
person or institution that helps us, becomes the co-founder of
Artots and gains real influence on our development and activity
path.
<li>
Every
piece of art we deliver is made by a disabled artist who wants to
offer their best to the world. They want to feel needed. Thanks to
you, they are.
<li>
The
disabled artists are not affected by any costs of the gallery
functioning. They do not have to make any charges to display their
work. We are here for them, not the opposite.
<li>
Artots
financial activity will always be transparent for the co-founders
and the disabled artists.
<li>
Artots
will be carrying out the worldwide campaign in order to make all
disabled artists from all over the globe aware that they can
participate in the project.
<li>
All
canvas, poster and wallpaper replicas are of the highest standards
and are made with organic raw materials.
<li>
Atrots
rejects omnipresent mass production and promotes the symbiosis of
Art and the Soul. Atrots.
